HDT.1.8: ta\ kala/ . 1.11: ta\ lego/mena . 1.13: e)s tw)uto/ . 1.18: to\ o(/moion . 1.20: pro\s to\ pareo/n . 1.22: e)s to\ e)/sxaton kakou= . 1.30: pa/nta, ta\ pa/nta . 1.30: to\ lexqe/n . 1.32: to\ qei=on . 2.2: a)/lla ma/taia polla/ . 3.2: ta\ *perse/wn no/mima . 4.5: e)moi\ ou) pista\ le/gontes . 5.6: to\ de\ a)/stikton a)genne/s (ke/kritai). 6.1: e)qw/umaze . . . to\ gegono/s . 7.5: polla\ kaka/ . 8.3: to\ nautiko/n . 9.2: ta\ sa/ .

AR. Eq. 187: o(/son pe/ponqas a)gaqo/n . Nub. 26: touti\ to\ kako)n . Vesp. 3: kako\n . . . me/ga . Pax, 272: e)n de/onti . Thesm. 23: pro\s toi=s a)gaqoi=s tou/toisin . Av.382: ma/qoi ga\r a)/n tis ka)po\ tw=n e)xqrw=n sofo/n . Ran.1: tw=n ei)wqo/twn . Ibid. 421: ka)sti\n (sc. *)arxe/dhmos) ta\ prw=ta th=s e)kei= moxqhri/as . Plut.2: ta\ be/ltista .

COM. 2.3 (M): ou)k e)/stin oi)kei=n oi)ki/an a)/neu kakou=. 2.9: tw=n kakw=n paroyi/des. 4.13: ta\ para\ toi=s a)/lloisin . . . kaka/. 4.22: le/gousi pa/nta ma=llon h)\ ti/ ta)gaqo/n. 4.39: pa/ntwn a)formh\ tw=n kalw=n eu(ri/sketai. 4.41: to\ peprwme/non . . . a)/feukto/n e/stin. 4.44: to\ lupou=n plei=on h)\ to\ sw=|zon.

EUR. Alc. 199: h)= pou stena/zei toisi/d' *)/admhtos kakoi=s . Andr. 184: kako/n ge qnhtoi=s to\ ne/on . Bacch. 216: neoxma\ . . . kaka/ . El. 431: i)/son fe/rei . Hec. 120: to\ . . . so
 . . . a)gaqo/n . Hel. 271: mei=zon th=s a)lhqei/as kako/n . Heracl. 570-1:
th=s te sh=s eu)yuxi/as
kai\ tou= dikai/ou (e(/kati). Herc. F. 509: o)nomasta\ pra/sswn. Hipp. 379: ta\ xrh/st' e)pista/mesqa. I. A. 408: e)s koino
 a)lgei=n toi=s fi/loisi xrh\ fi/lous. I. T. 559: kako
 di/kaion ei)sepra/cato. Ion, 969: ta\ qnhta\ toiau=ta . Med. 330: e)/rwtes . . . kako
 me/ga. Or. 397: sofo/n toi to\ safe/s, ou) to\ mh\ safe/s . Phoen. 597: filo/yuxon kako/n. Suppl. 435: nika=| d' o( mei/wn to
 me/gan di/kai) e)/xwn. Tro.489: qrigko\s a)qli/wn kakw=n. fr. 21.3 N2: ou)k a)
 ge/noito xwri\s e)sqla\ kai\ kaka/. 80: feu= feu=, ta\ mega/la mega/la kai\ pa/sxei kaka/. 236: su
 muri/oisi ta\ kala\ gi/gnetai po/nois. 275.4: ka)
 smi/kr' e)/xh| tis, mega/l) e)/xein nomize/tw.

SOPH. Ai. 1003: i)/q', e)kka/luyon, w(s i)/dw to\ pa=n kako/n . Antig. 77: ta\ tw=n qew=n e)/ntima . El. 333: a)lgw= )pi\ toi=s parou=sin . Ibid. 384: e)n kalw=| fronei=n . O. C. 771: to\ suggene\s tou=to . O. T. 110-1:
to\ de\ zhtou/menon
a(lwto/n, e)kfeu/gei de\ ta)melou/menon
. Ibid. 800: ta)lhqe\s e)cerw= . Ph. 446: ou)de/n pw kako/n g' a)pw/leto . Ibid. 674-5: to\ . . . nosou=n . Ibid. 919: sw=sai kakou= . Tr. 196: to\ poqou=n . Trach. 474: pa=n soi fra/sw ta)lhqe/s . fr. 100 N2: to\ kalw=s pefuko/s. fr. 321 N2: fronei=n . . . i)/sa. fr. 326 N2: ta\ yeudh= le/gein.

AESCHYL. Ag. 79: to/ q' u(pe/rghrwn . Cho. 212: eu)/xou ta\ loipa/ . Eum.276: didaxqei\s e)n kakoi=s. Pers.228: e)kteloi=to dh\ ta\ xrhsta/. Aesch. P. V. 26: tou= paro/ntos a)xqhdw\n kakou= . S. c. Th. 1: xrh\ le/gein ta\ kai/ria. Suppl. 77: to\ di/kaion i)do/ntes. fr. 390 N2: o( xrh/sim' ei)dw/s, ou)x o( po/ll' ei)dw\s sofo/s. 396 N2: manqa/nein sofa/.
TRAG. fr. adesp. 31 N2: ou)k a)ciw= mikrw=n se, mega/la d' ou)k e)/xw. Ibid. 513.2 N2: ta)ma\ ga\r kalw=s e)/xei.

PIND. (not overcommon). PIND. O.1.31: a(/panta . . . ta\ mei/lixa . Ibid. 2.36: a)teirei= su
 a)gaqw=| . Ibid. 2.62: oi)=den to\ me/llon . Ibid. 9.28: w)/pasan ta\ terpna . Ibid. 9.94: ka/llista . . . r(e/cais . Ibid. 10.55: to\ safane/s . Ibid. 12.9: tw=n de\ mello/ntwn tetu/flwntai fradai/ . Ibid. 13.103: ta/ t' e)sso/mena to/t' a)
 fai/hn safe/s . Ibid. 14.5-6: su
 ga u)/mmin . . . ta\ gluke/' a)/netai pa/nta brotoi=s . P. 1.86: mh\ pari/ei kala/ . N. 11.42: e)n a)mei/bonti .
BACCHYL. fr. 1.1: moi=ran . . . kalw=n.
SIMONID. C. fr. 37.13: to/ ge deino/n.

SAPPH. fr. 51:
a)ra/santo de\ pa/mpan e)/sla
tw=| ga/mbrw| .
SOLON, fr. 4.32: kaka\ plei=sta po/lei dusnomi/a pare/xei.
ALCAE. fr. 35.1: ou) xrh\ ka/koisi qu=mon e)pitre/phn.
ARCH. fr. 20: klai/w ta\ *qasi/wn, ou) ta\ *magnh/twn kaka/.
HYMN. HOM. 4.44: ke/dn' ei)dui=an .

HES. O. et D. 40: o(/sw| ple/on h(/misu panto/s . Ibid. 91: a)/ter te kakw=n kai\ a)/ter xalepoi=o po/noio . Ibid. 116-7:
e)sqla\ de\ pa/nta
toi=sin e)/hn
. Theog. 28: a)lhqe/a ghru/sasqai .

HOM. Od. 1, [140]=4.56=7.176=10, [372]=15, [139]=17,95: pareo/ntwn. 1.274: e)pi\ sfe/tera ski/dnasqai . 1.428: kedna\ i)dui=a . 2.231: ai)/sima ei)dw/s . 2.369: e)pi\ soi=si kaqh/menos . 3.115: penta/ete/s ge kai\ e(ca/etes . 3.118: ei)na/etes . 3.247: a)lhqe/s . 3.277: fi/la ei)do/tes . 4.460: o)lofw/ia ei)dw/s . 4.695=22.319: e)uerge/wn . 4.696 and 711: pepnume/na ei)dw/s . 4.837: a)nemw/lia ba/zein . 5.182: ou)k a)pofw/lia ei)dw/s . 5.476: e)n perifainome/nw| . 7.166: e)/ndon e)o/ntwn . 7.310: ai)/sima pa/nta . 8.66=473: me/ssw| . 8.262: e)s me/son . 8.405: pole/os . 8.584: kexarisme/na ei)dw/s . 9.189: a)qemi/stia h)/|dei . 9.474: kertomi/oisin . 11.432: lugra\ i)dui=a . 13.405: h)/pia oi)=den . 14.12: to\ me/lan druo/s . 14.91: ne/esqai e)pi\ sfe/tera
14.125: a)lhqe/a . 14.288: a)path/lia ei)dw/s . 14.433: ai)/sima h)/|dei . 15.77: e)/ndon e)o/ntwn . 15.88: nei=sqai e)f' h(me/tera . 17.452: a)llotri/wn . 17.456: a)llotri/ois . 18.404: ta\ xerei/ona . 18.414: e)pi\ r(hqe/nti dikai/w| . 19.248: a)/rtia h)/|dei . 19.329: o(\s . . . a)phne/a ei)dh=| . 20.177: kertomi/oisin . 21.85: e)fhme/ria frone/ontes .

HOM. Il. 1.70: ta/ t' e)o/nta ta/ t' e)sso/mena pro/ t' e)o/nta . 1.106: to\ krh/guon . 1.107: ta\ ka/k' . 1.539: kertomi/oisi . 1.542: krupta/dia frone/onta . 1.576: ta\ xerei/ona . 2.213: a)/kosma/ te polla/ te h)/|dei . 3.69: e)n me/ssw| . 4.161: su/n te mega/lw| a)pe/tisan . 4.185: e)n kairi/w| . 4.256: meilixi/oisin . 4.541: kata\ me/sson . 6.162: a)gaqa\ frone/onta . 6.376: nhmerte/a muqh/sasqe . 6.382: a)lhqe/a . 7.238: e)pi\ decia/ . . . e)p' a)ristera/ . 7.277: me/ssw| . 8.491=10.199: e)n kaqarw=| . 9.579: to\ . . . h(/misu . 10.357: dourhneke/s . 11.336: kata\ i)=sa . 12.436: e)pi\ i)=sa . 13.824: poi=on e)/eipes . 17.431: meilixi/oisi . 21.214: peri\ d' ai)/sula r(e/zeis . 22.497: o)neidei/oisin . 23.275 and 538: ta\ prw=ta , first prize.
23.538: deu/tera , second prize.
23.562: pole/os . 23.570: poi=on e)/recas . 23.751: loisqh/ia , last prize.
24.531: tw=n lugrw=n . For cei/nion, cei/nia, ceinh/ion, ceinh/ia, see Hom. Dict..

p.hi: Neuter plural of adjectives and verbals in -tos and -te/os.

div2.p: Especially to be noticed in this connection is the use of the neuter plural of adjectives and of verbals for the singular. This use is not a standard prose use. See Bishop, A. P. xx (1899), 1-21 and 121-138.
ploi+mw/tera e)ge/neto, THUC. 1.8.2 ; Greater facilities of navigation ensued.
ORATORES ATTICI: No occurrence according to E. R. Schulze, Quaestiunculae grammaticae ad oratores Atticos spectantes, Bautzen, 1889.
PLATO: In Rpb. 416 E, Krüger suggests o(si/a for o(/sia, and Ibid. 562 A, cited by Matth. § 443, is not an example.

XEN. An. 3.4.49: e(/ws me
 ba/sima h)=n, e)pi\ tou= i(/ppou h)=gen, e)pei\ de\ a)/bata h)=n, katalipw
 to
 i(/ppon e)/speude pezh=| . Ibid. 4.6.17: e)a/nper a(/pac la/bwme/n ti tou= o)/rous, bata\ kai\ toi=s u(pozugi/ois| e)/stai .

THUC.1.8.2: katasta/ntos de\ tou= *mi/nw nautikou= ploi+mw/tera e)ge/neto par' a)llh/lous . 1.72.1: parithte/a . 1.79.2: polemhte/a . 1.86.3: paradote/a, diakrite/a, timwrhte/a . 1.88: polemhte/a . 1.93.4: a)nqekte/a . 2.3.3: e)do/kei ou)=n e)pixeirhte/a ei)=nai . 2.10.2, and 56.1: e(toi=ma. 3.16.2: a)/pora . 4.1.3 and 5.14.4: a)du/nata. 6.25.2: pleuste/a . 6.50.5: polemhte/a .

HDT.1.4: dh=la . . . o(/ti . 1.91: th\n peprwme/nhn moi=ran a)du/nata/ e)sti a)pofugei=n kai\ qew=| . 1.112: bebouleume/na e)/stai . 1.194: oi(=a/ te , and frequently. 1.207: dh=la , and frequently. 3.61: a)kouste/a . 3.109: biw/sima . 5.124 and 6.13: a)du/nata . 6.106: same. 7.185: proslogiste/a . 9.2: xalepa/ .
COM. 4.661: a)no/hta/ g' ei) tou=t' h)=lqes e)pita/cwn e)moi/.

EUR. Alc. 218: dh=la (twice). Bacch. 1039: suggnwsta/ . Hec. 1107: same. H. F.583: di/kaia tou\s teko/ntas (subj.) w)felei=n te/kna (obj.). Hipp. 269: a)/shma. Med. 703: suggnwsta/ . Or. 413: ou) deina/ . Phoen. 994: suggnwsta/.
SOPH. Ai. 887: sxe/tlia . Ibid. 1126: di/kaia . Ant. 576: dedogme/na . Ibid. 677: a)munte/a . Ibid. 678: h(sshte/a . Ph. 524: ai)sxra/ . Tr. 495, 1116: di/kaia.
AESCHYL. Pr. V. 216: kra/tista .
PIND. O. 1.53: a)/pora . P. 1.34: e)oiko/ta . 2.81: a)du/nata . 4.247: makra/ . N. 8.4: a)gapata/ .

HOM. Od. 8.299: ou)ke/ti fukta\ pe/lonto , but Od. 5.359: o(/qi moi fa/to fu/cimon ei)=nai . 11, [456]: e)pei\ ou)ke/ti pista\ gunaici/n . 14.489: ou)ke/ti fukta\ pe/lontai . 20.223: ou)ke/t' a)nekta\ pe/lontai .
Il. 14.97-8: o)/fra. . . *trwsi\ me\n eu)kta\ ge/nhtai . 16.128: mh\ dh\ nh=as e(/lwsi kai\ ou)ke/ti fukta\ pe/lwntai .
Definite ellipses of neuter substantives are rare.
qermw=| ( u(/dati ) . . . lou=sqai, AR. Nub. 1044 ; To bathe in hot water.
HDT.2.37: lou=ntai de\ di\s th=s h(me/rhs e(ka/sths yuxrw=| (sc. u(/dati).
AR. Eccl. 216: ba/ptousi qermw=| .
COM. 3.445: to\ qermo/n.
THEOGN. 263: yuxro/n moi para\ th=|de fi/loi pi/nousi tokh=es.

p.hi: Possessive pronoun or possessive genitive with adjectives and participles used substantively.

div2.p: Unless an adjective or participle is fully substantivized it does not take a possessive pronoun, and seldom the possessive genitive in attributive position.
ta\ tou= dh/mou sumfe/ronta, DIN.1.107 ; The commons' interests.
to\n o(mw/numon to\n e)mautou=, DEM. 3.21 ; That namesake of mine.
tw=| sw=| o(mwnu/mw|, PLATO, Theaet. 147D ; Your namesake.
DIN.1.107(see above).

DEM.3.21(see above). 18.47: to\ tou= prodido/ntos sumfe/ron . 18.138: to\ th=s po/lews sumfe/ron. 18.139: to\ tw=n e)xqrw=n sumfe/ron, but ibid.: peri\ tw=n sumfero/ntwn th=| po/lei. 37.1: tou= dikai/ou tou/tou. [56]DEM., 28: meta\ tou= sumfe/rontos tou= tw=n daneistw=n.
AESCHIN.3.80: tou= u(mete/rou sumfe/rontos.
ISOC.5.24: toi=s e)pithdei/ois toi=s e)moi=s.

LYS. [2] 71: tou\s prosh/kontas au)tw=n e)leei=n , but LYS. [2], 76: tou\s tou/tois prosh/kontas , and 12.72: ta\ th=| po/lei sumfe/ronta . 12.79: para\ . . . tw=n toutoui+\ sunarxo/ntwn . 12.87: tou\s suna/rxontas au)tou= .
AND.2.9: tw=| e)mw=| ai)sxrw=|.
ANT. 5.7: tw=| u(mete/rw| dikai/w| . 5.18: toi=s e)moi=s prosh/kousin , but 5.59: tw=n e)moi\ proshko/ntwn . 5.59: tw=n e)kei/nou a)nagkai/wn .

PLATO, Apol. 34B: oi( tou/twn prosh/kontes. Cf. Legg. 868 B: tw=n proshko/ntwn tw=| teleuth/santi, but just below: tou\s prosh/kontas tou= teleuth/santos. Cf. ibid. 868 C: toi=s prosh/kousi tou= teleuth/santos, and ibid. 947 C: oi( prosh/kontes tou= teleuth/santos. Phaedr. 240 A: to\ au(tou= gluku/. Rpb. 338 C: to\ tou= krei/ttonos . . . cumfe/ron, and similarly often. Theaet. 147 D (see above).
XEN. Apol. 27: toi=s e)moi=s eu)/nois . Hell. 5.2.33: toi=s . . . u(mete/rois dusmene/si .
THUC.2.61.2: e)n tw=| u(mete/rw| a)sqenei= th=s gnw/mhs. 5.46.1: e)n me\n tw=| sfete/rw| kalw=|, e)n de\ tw=| e)kei/nwn a)prepei= . 6.11.6: to\ sfe/teron a)prepe/s .
HDT.3.65: u(po\ tw=n e(wutou= oi)khiota/twn.
AR. Eq. 845: a(paca/pantas tou\s e)mou\s e)xqrou\s e)pistomi/zein . Pl. 631: w)= be/ltiste tw=n sautou= fi/lwn .
EUR. Alc. 167: w(/sper au)tw=n h( tekou=s' a)po/llumai. El. 335: o(/ t' e)kei/nou tekw/n. Hipp. 1007: to\ sw=fron tou)mo/n. I. A. 1270: ou)d' e)pi\ to\ kei/nou boulo/menon e)lh/luqa.
On the use of a Neuter Adjective as the Predicate of a Masculine or Feminine Subject, see under Concord, 126.
xrh=ma and pra=gma are often used to make a substantive of an adjective. The use of xrh=ma and pra=gma resembles that of a)nh/r.
kou=fon ga\r xrh=ma poihth/s e)sti, PLATO, Ion 534B ; A poet is a light and airy thing.
ORATORES ATTICI: xrh=ma not in DEM., LYS., and ANTIPHON.
DEM. [35]. 15-6: *la/kritos me/ga pra=gma, *)isokra/tous maqhth/s.
PLATO, Gorg. 485B: pikro/n ti/ moi dokei= xrh=ma ei)=nai. Ion, 534 B (see above).
XEN. Cyr. 1.4.8: kataba/llei th\n e)/lafon, kalo/n ti xrh=ma kai\ me/ga .
HDT.3.53: turanni\s xrh=ma sfalero/n. 5.96: pa=n xrh=ma e)ki/nee , and xrh=ma elsewhere in Herodotus.
AR. Nub. 816: ti/ xrh=ma pa/sxeis; and similarly elsewhere in comedy and tragedy. Lys. 511: me/ga pra=gma . Ibid. 677: i(ppikw/taton . . . xrh=ma . Pl. 856: sxe/tlia . . . pra/gmata .
COM. 4.4: dhmotiko\n . . . pra=gma kai\ swth/rion.
EUR. Or.70: a)/poron xrh=ma dustuxw=n do/mos .
PIND. O. 9.104: xrh=m' e(/kaston .

div2.head: Abstract nouns

p.hi: Abstract noun used as a concrete.

div2.p:
Akin to the use of an adjective as a substantive is the employment of an abstract as a concrete. So
a(gemo/neuma = h(gemw/n
a)kolouqi/a, train
a)/lhma
a)/th
bi/o|s, livelihood
bo/skhma
ge/lws, laughing-stock
genea/, kindred for kinsman
gene/qlh
ge/nesis
ge/nos
go/nos
doulei/a
e)le/gxea
e)/ris
e(tairi/a
zhlw/mata
h(liki/a
qerapei/a
ka/llos
ka/qarma, offscouring, outcast
kata/pauma
kathfei/h
kh/deuma
kro/thma
kw/kuma
lh=ros
lo/xeuma
me/geqos
me/lhma
mh/nima
mh=nis
mh=tis
mi/asma
neo/ths
no/sos, plague
nu/mfeuma
o)/leqros
o)mhliki/h
cugge/neia
pai/deusis
paipa/lhma
peri/trimma
ph_ma
po/qos
poi/mnh
po/nos
presbei/a
presbeu/mata
stu/gos
sugge/neia
summaxi/a
timai/
tri=mma
trofh/
u(/brisma
u(phresi/a
fqo/ros
filo/ths
flo/c
fo/nos
fugh/
fulakh/
xa/rma

Many of the above examples are exclusively poetical, others are colloquial or vulgar, and some belong to neither sphere. For references see the dictionaries. A few illustrative passages are cited below. Compare Massinger, “Careless harlotry”; Shaks., “What trade art thou?”
soi\ d' a)reth=s, w)= ka/qarm(a) . . . ti/s metousi/a; DEM.18.128, You and virtue, you offscouring of the earth, what have you in common with her?
DEM.18.127: peri/trimm' a)gora=s, o)/leqros grammateu/s . Ibid. 128 (see above).
PLATO, Phaedr. 228D: w)= filo/ths. Ibid. 252 A: koima=sqai . . . e)gguta/tw tou= po/qou. Theaet. 176 D: oi)/ontai a)kou/ein o(/ti ou) lh=roi/ ei)si, gh=s a)/llws a)/xqh.
XEN. Cyr. 5.2.7: th\n qugate/ra, deino/n ti ka/llos kai\ me/geqos , An awful beauty and divinely tall.
THUC.2.41.1: cunelw/n te le/gw th/n te pa=san po/lin th=s *(ella/dos pai/deusin (school) ei)=nai .
HDT.1.31: tou/toisi . . . bi/os te a)rke/wn u(ph=n, They had substance enough.
AR. Nub.447: peri/trimma dikw=n .

EUR. Phoen. 30-1:
h(\ de\ to\n e)mo\n w)di/nwn po/non
mastoi=s u(fei=to . [Rhes.] 498-9:
e)/sti d' ai(mulw/taton
kro/thm' *)odusseu/s . fr. 530: *ku/pridos de\ mi/shm(a), Cf. “She is my pet aversion.”

SOPH. Ant. 650: yuxro\n paragka/lisma , Hugging-piece (wife). O. C. 902-3:
w(s mh\ . . . ge/lws . . . e)gw\
ce/nw| ge/nwmai tw=|de
. fr. 827: kro/thma.

AESCHYL. Cho. 1027-8:
ktanei=n te/ fhmi mhte/r' ou)k a)/neu di/khs , | patrokto/non mi/asma kai\ qew=n stu/gos.

PIND. P.4.135-6:
tw=n d' a)kou/sais au)to\s u(panti/asen
*turou=s e)rasiploka/mou genea/ . Ibid. 250: fo/non, murderess.
HOM. Il. 2.235: ka/k' e)le/gxea . Ibid. 9.538: di=on ge/nos .

The Greeks had no terms for our abstract and concrete, which are imperfectly represented, the one by pra=gma, the other by sw=ma. What we call abstract formations are largely feminine and neuter, feminine collectives, neuter collectives: the feminine goes back to personification (the mother gender), the neuter to result (fruit), mass.

p.hi: Plural of abstract substantives used distributively.

div2.p: In Greek, the plural of abstract substantives is used distributively with far more freedom than in modern English. In Old English compare “Lete us two preue oure strengthes,” Morte d'Arthur, 193.22, and similarly elsewhere.

ou)d\ a)pe/bleyen (sc. o( dh=mos) ei)s ta\s ou)si/as ta\s tou/twn, DEM.21.2: The commons had no regard to their substance (property). pollw=n ga\r ta\ me/rh to\n a)delfo\n a)posterei=, 36.36; He deprives his brother of his share(s) in many things.
DEM.21.2(see above). 30.21: a)delfw=n kai\ qugate/rwn bi/ous e)gxeiri/zomen, u(pe\r w(=n ta\s a)sfalei/as ma/lista skopou=men. 36.36 (see above).

ISOC.2.46: ta\s a)lhqei/as tw=n pragma/twn. 3.15: ta\s i)so/thtas toi=s mete/xousi tw=n politeiw=n zhtou=si. 3.20: ta\s eu)noi/as e)/xousin. 4.151: ta\ . . . sw/mata dia\ tou\s plou/tous trufw=ntes. (In Isocrates the plural is so marked a mannerism, and is so often suggested by the avoidance of hiatus, that it is not necessary to insist on sharp distinctions in that author.)
ANT.1.28: ou) . . . martu/rwn g' e)nanti/on oi( e)pibouleu/ontes tou\s qana/tous toi=s pe/las mhxanw=ntai.

PLATO, Legg. 625B-C: kupari/ttwn te e)n toi=s a)/lsesin u(/yh kai\ ka/llh, The height and beauty of the cypresses in the groves. Rpb. 425 A: siga/s te tw=n newte/rwn para\ presbute/rois, Silence of the juniors in the presence of seniors.
XEN. Cyr. 3.3.19: r(w/mais . Hell. 6.1.5: tai=s h(liki/ais .
THUC.7.55.2: po/lesi . . . kai\ nau=s kai\ i(/ppous kai\ mege/qh e)xou/sais.

HDT.1.202; 2.10: mega/qea . 3.102: mu/rmhkes mega/qea e)/xontes kunw=n me\n e)la/ssona, a)lwpe/kwn de\ me/zona . 3.107: mega/qea . 6.58: tw=n ga\r w)=n barba/rwn oi( pleu=nes tw=| au)tw=| no/mw| xre/wntai kata\ tou\s qana/tous tw=n basile/wn, At the death of their kings. 7.103: mega/qea.
AR. Pl.530: i(mati/wn baptw=n dapa/nais .
EUR. Phoen. 870: ai(/ q' ai(matwpoi\ dergma/twn diafqorai/ .
SOPH. O. C. 552: ta\s ai(mathra\s o)mma/twn diafqora/s . Ph. 304: ou)k e)nqa/d' oi( ploi= toi=si sw/frosin brotw=n .
AESCHYL. Ag. 404-5: lipou=sa d' a)stoi=sin . . . nauba/tas o(plismou/s.

PIND. O. 4.12: trofai=s e(toi=mon i(/ppwn (= i(ppotrofi/ais). Ibid. 9.19: stefa/nwn a)/wtoi. Ibid. 12.9: tw=n . . . mello/ntwn . . . fradai/. P. 1.4: prooimi/wn a)mbola/s. Ibid. 10.72: poli/wn kuberna/sies. I. 3 [4], 48: tw=n a)peira/twn ga\r a)/gnwstoi siwpai/.
The distributive singular of abstract nouns is less common in Greek than the plural, and the distributive singular of concrete nouns is rare.
kakoi\ th\n yuxh/n, AESCHIN.3.47; Base of soul.
AESCHIN.3.47(see above).
PLATO, Rpb. 452B: mh\ h(dei=s th\n o)/yin.
XEN. An. 2.3.15: qauma/siai tou= ka/llous kai\ mege/qous .

THUC.2.70.3: e)celqei=n au)tou\s . . . cu
 e(ni\ i(mati/w|, gunai=kas de\ cu
 duoi=n . 3.22.2: to
 a)ristero
 po/da mo/non u(podedeme/noi . 3.22.3: yiloi\ dw/deka cu
 cifidi/w| kai\ qw/raki a)ne/bainon , but ibid. just below: yiloi\ a)/lloi . . . cu
 dorati/ois e)xw/roun. 4.4.2: to
 phlo
 . . . e)pi\ tou= nw/tou e)/feron , They carried the clay upon their backs.
6.44.2: a)gora=| ou)de\ a)/stei, u(/dati de\ kai\ o(/rmw| . 8.96.5: dia/foroi . . . to
 tro/pon .
HDT.1.31: tou/toisi . . . u(ph=n . . . r(w/mh sw/matos.
AR. Pax, 607: ta\s fu/seis u(mw=n dedoikw\s kai\ to\n au)toda\c tro/pon . Av. 643: kai\ tou)/nom' h(mi=n fra/saton .
EUR. Cycl. 225: sw=ma sumpeplegme/nous. H. F. 703: kosmei=sqe sw=ma.
SOPH. O.T. 1375: a)ll' h( te/knwn dh=t' o)/yis h)=n e)fi/meros .

AESCHYL. Pers. 441-2:
a)kmai=oi fu/sin
yuxh/n t' a)/ristoi keu)ge/neian e)kprepei=s .

div2.head: Plurals

p.hi: Plural abstract nouns used concretely.—plural of proper nouns.

div2.p: Pluralizing abstract nouns makes them concrete; pluralizing proper nouns makes them common.
ta\s *)alkmh/nas, AR. Av. 558 ; Your Alcmenas (women like Alcmena).
DEM. [26]DEM., 19: dia\ ta\s tou/twn a)ponoi/as. 38.21: fo/noi kai\ u(/breis, Murders and outrages. [42]DEM., 8: peri\ tw=n a)/llwn a)kou/sesqe pa/sas ta\s a)lhqei/as.

ISOC.7.4: toi=s plou/tois, tai=s dunastei/ais, tai=s e)ndei/ais, tai=s tapeino/thsi. 7.44: ei)do/tes ta\s a)pori/as me\n dia\ ta\s a)rgi/as gignome/nas, ta\s de\ kakourgi/as dia\ ta\s a)pori/as. 8.90: e)n sitodei/ais kai\ poliorki/ais. (See note on Isocrates above, 42.)
PLATO, Phaed. 84C: polla)/s ga\r dh\ e)/ti e)/xei (sc. ta\ lexqe/nta) u(poyi/as kai\ a)ntilaba/s.
XEN. Hell. 6.3.8: e)oi/kate turanni/si ma=llon h)\ politei/ais h(do/menoi .
THUC.6.77.1: *leonti/nwn te cuggenw=n katoiki/seis kai\ *)egestai/wn cumma/xwn e)pikouri/as.
HDT.3.40: e)moi\ de\ ai( sai\ mega/lai eu)tuxi/ai ou)k a)re/skousi.

AR. Nub. 1071-3:
ske/yai . . . h(donw=n . . . o(/swn me/lleis a)posterei=sqai
pai/dwn, gunaikw=n, kte(
. 1075: ta\s th=s fu/sews a)na/gkas .
EUR. H. F. 835: mani/as.
SOPH. El. 873: fe/rw ga\r h(dona/s .
PIND. O. 1.14: a)reta=n. So forms of a)retai/, ibid. 92; 2.12; 4.9; 5.1; 15, etc. Ibid. 9.39: mani/aisin. Ibid. 9.99 and N. 9.31: a)glai+/aisin. N. 11.48: mani/ai.
HOM. Od. 1.297: nhpia/as . 12.341: pa/ntes me\n stugeroi\ qa/natoi deiloi=si brotoi=si . 17.244: a)glai+/as .
Il. 4.107: e)n prodokh=|si. 9.115: e)ma\s a)/tas kate/lecas (metre would admit of sing.). 10.391: pollh=|sin . . . a)/th|si.
Not so clearly concrete is the Homeric use of many other abstract plurals, chiefly datives in -h|si, and forms of nouns in -su/nh. Metre may have had its influence. See also Stein on HDT.3.52.

PLATO, Conv. 218A and B: o(rw=n au)= *fai/drous, *)aga/qwnas, *)erucima/xous, *pausani/as, *)aristodh/mous te kai\ *)aristofa/nas. Crat.432C: du/o *kratu/loi. Menex. 245 D: *pe/lopes . . . *ka/dmoi . . . *ai)/guptoi . . . *danaoi/. Theaet. 169 B: *(hrakle/es te kai\ *qhse/es.
XEN. An. 3.2.31: muri/ous o)/yontai a)nq' e(no\s *klea/rxous .
THUC.6.27.1: o(/soi *(ermai= h)=san li/qinoi e)n th=| po/lei, Statues of Hermes.
HDT.3.160: *babulw=nas . . . ei)/kosi pro\s th=| e)ou/sh|.
AR. Av. 558-9: ta\s *)alkmh/nas . . . ta\s *)alo/pas kai\ ta\s *seme/las .
AESCHYL. Ag. 1439: *xrushi+/dwn mei/ligma tw=n u(p' *)ili/w|.
TRAG. fr. adesp. 289 N2: e)ch=lqon *(/ektore/s te kai\ *sarphdo/nes.
HOM. Il. 18.157: du/' *ai)/antes . Cf. ibid. 163: du/w *ai)/ante .
Plural expressions that diverge from English proceed from different concep tions. puroi/, wheat (grains), kriqai/, barley (corns), kre/a (pieces of) meat, a(/les (grains of) salt.
cu/la, purou/s, DEM.19.145; Wood, wheat.
DEM.19.145(see above). 19.189: pou= d' a(/les; 19.191: tou\s a(/las.

PLATO, Conv. 217D: dielego/mhn po/rrw tw=n nuktw=n , Till late in the night (watches). Prot. 318 E: logismou/s (computations) te kai\ a)stronomi/an . . . dida/skontes. Rpb. 372 C: a(/las. Ibid. 621 B: me/sas nu/ktas gene/sqai (so regularly me/sai nu/ktes).
XEN. An. 6.4.6: kriqa\s kai\ purou\s . . . kai\ meli/nas kai\ sh/sama kte( . Cyr. 2.2.2: kre/a . . . tri/a . Hell. 3.3.7: cu/la .
THUC.4.16.1: du/o xoi/nikas . . . a)lfi/twn. 4.6.22: purou\s kai\ pefrugme/nas kriqa/s . 7.87.1: oi( . . . h(/lioi (Heat of the sun on successive days).
HDT.4.8: a)po\ h(li/ou a)natole/wn, and so a)natolai/ elsewhere. 7.30: li/mnhn e)k th=s a(/les gi/nontai.
AR. Pax, 192: ta\ kre/a tauti/ , and kre/a very often in Aristophanes. Av. 622: kriqa/s, purou/s . Ibid. 626: purou\s o)li/gous .
EUR. Cycl. 122: ga/lakti kai\ turoi=si (sc. zw=si). El. 652: h(li/ous, days.

SOPH. Tr. 1053-4:
e)k me\n e)sxa/tas
be/brwke sa/rkas
.
AESCHYL. Eum.254: o)smh\ brotei/wn ai(ma/twn.
PIND. fr. 168 Bgk.4: sarkw=n . . . e)nopa/n.

HOM. Od. 4.604: puroi/, and forms of puroi/ elsewhere. 9.219 and 225: turw=n. 11.123 and 23.270: a(/lessi, but 17.455: su/ g' a)\n . . . ou)d' a(/la doi/hs . 18.77: sa/rkes , and forms of sa/rkes elsewhere. 22.21: kre/a , and so forms of kre/a often in Iliad and Odyssey.
Il. 5.588: koni/h|si(n), and so regularly, but 23.732 and elsewhere: koni/h|. 23.15: deu/onto ya/maqoi, and forms of ya/maqoi often in Iliad and Odyssey.

p.hi: Plural of feminine names of towns and of parts of the human body.

div2.p: Feminine names of towns in the plural are dualistic. So also symmetrical parts of the human body, not a common prose usage.
DEM.9.27: plhsi/on *qhbw=n kai\ *)aqhnw=n. 16.25: ta\s . . . *qespia\s . . . kai\ ta\s *plataia/s. 18.48: a)pw/lese *qh/bas. 19.158: ei)s *fera/s. [56]DEM., 5: ei)s *)aqh/nas, etc.
PLATO, Legg. 753A: me/ga . . . fronou=sin ai( *)aqh=nai.
XEN. Vect. 1.6: ta\s *)aqh/nas .
THUC.1.31.3: e)s ta\s *)aqh/nas. 2.8.1: e)n tai=s *)aqh/nais .
HDT.1.60: *)aqh/nas.
AR. Nub. 207: ai(/de me\n *)aqh=nai .
I. T. 1087: ei)s ta\s *)aqh/nas.
SOPH. O. C. 107-8: w)= . . . *)aqh=nai .
AESCHYL. Pers. 231: ta\s *)aqh/nas.
PIND. P. 7.1: ai( megalopo/lies *)aqa=nai.
HES. fr. 129: *)aqhna/wn i(era/wn.
HOM. Od. 11.323: *)aqhna/wn i(era/wn.
Il. 2.546: *)aqh/nas ei)=xon.
PLATO, Prot. 352A: i)/qi dh/ moi a)pokalu/yas kai\ ta\ sth/qh kai\ to\ meta/frenon e)pi/deicon, and forms of sth/qh of a single individual elsewhere.

XEN. An. 2.6.11: au)tou= e)n toi=s prosw/pois , if the reading is correct. Cyr. 4.6.4: pai/sas ei)s ta\ ste/rna to\n . . . pai=da , and so forms of ste/rna elsewhere, but An. 1.8.26: pai/ei kata\ to\ ste/rnon .
THUC.2.49.3: e)s ta\ sth/qh.
AR. Lys. 810: ta\ pro/swpa , if the reading is correct. Thesm. 1067: a)steroeide/a nw=ta .
EUR. El.1321: peri/ moi ste/rnois ste/rna pro/sayon, and so forms of ste/rna elsewhere. Hel. 1568: me/twpa (sc. tau/rou). Tr. 763: e)moi=s nw/toisi, and so forms of nw=ta elsewhere.
SOPH. El. 1277: tw=n sw=n prosw/pwn , and so forms of pro)swpa elsewhere. Tr. 1090: w)= nw=ta kai\ ste/rn(a), and so forms of nw=ta and ste/rna elsewhere.
AESCHYL. P.V. 65: ste/rnwn diampa/c , and so forms of ste/rna elsewhere; sing. not in Aeschylus. Ibid. 430: nw/tois (of Atlas).
PIND. P. 1.19: ste/rna laxna/enta . N. 9.26: nw=ta .

HOM. Od. 6.107: me/twpa (the only instance of the plural of this word in Iliad and Odyssey). 6.225: nw=ta, and so forms of nw=ta often. 8.85: pro/swpa, and so elsewhere. 18.69: sth/qea, and so forms of sth/qea often. ste/rna not found in sing. sense in
Il. 8.94: nw=ta. 13.290: ste/rnwn. 18.414: pro/swpa, and so forms of pro/swpa elsewhere. 18.415: sth/qea, and so forms of sth/qea elsewhere.

p.hi: Name of the inhabitants as the name of the city.

div2.p: The name of the inhabitants is sometimes used instead of the city: (oi() *delfoi/, Delphi, (oi() *leonti=noi.

kai\ krath/santes tou= e)n *delfoi=s i(erou= pare/dosan *delfoi=s, Thuc.1.112.5; And having made themselves masters of the sancturary at Delphi (among the Delphians), they handed it over to the Delphians.
DEM.19.65: ei)s *delfou/s. 21.51: e)k *delfw=n kai\ e)k *dwdw/nhs. 25.34: e)n *delfoi=s, and similarly often in
ISOC.9.27: swqei\s ei)s *so/lous th=s *kiliki/as .
PLATO, Legg. 738C: e)k *delfw=n h)\ *dwdw/nhs, and similarly forms of *delfoi/ often.
XEN. An. 1.2.24: e)n *so/lois kai\ e)n *)issoi=s . 1.2.26: th/n te po/lin tou\s *tarsou\s dih/rpasan . 3.1.5: e)lqo/nta ei)s *delfou/s , and similarly forms of *delfoi/ elsewhere.
THUC.1.112.5(see above). 6.3.3: *leonti/nous.
HDT.1.14: e)s *delfou/s, and similarly often.
ISOC.9.16: mo/nou tou/tou (sc. *phle/ws) fasi\ tw(=n progegenhme/nwn u(po\ qew=n e)n toi=s ga/mois u(me/naion a)|sqh=nai.
PLATO, Protag. 315E: paidika\ *pausani/ou tugxa/nei w)/n, and so paidika/ elsewhere. Rpb. 383 B: e)n toi=s au(th=s (sc. *qe/tidos) ga/mois.
XEN. Ven. 1.7: tw=n . . . megi/stwn ga/mwn mo/nos e)/tuxen (sc. *melani/wn) *)atala/nths .
THUC.1.132.5: a)nh\r *)argi/lios, paidika/ pote w)\n au)tou=.
HDT.3.10: e)ta/fh e)n th=|si tafh_|si . . . ta\s au)to\s oi)kodomh/sato. 5.63: tafai/.

AR. Ach. 450: a)pwqou=mai do/mwn (parod.). 456: do/mwn (parod.). Vesp. 1026: paidi/x' e(autou= . Pax, 1206: soi . . . ei)s tou\s ga/mous . Av. 132: e(stia=n ga/mous . Ran. 423: e)n tai=s tafai=si (parod.).
EUR. Hipp. 11: *(ippo/lutos, a(gnou= *pitqe/ws paideu/mata. Ion, 192: xruse/ais a(/rpais . Or. 1053: mnh=ma . . . ke/drou texna)smata .

SOPH. Ai. 231: kelainoi=s ci/fesin . Ibid. 1090 and 1109: ei)s tafa/s , tomb. O. R.825: ga/mois, and sim. elsewhere. Ibid. 861: i)/wmen e)s do/mous. Ibid. 1006: sou= pro\s do/mous e)lqo/ntos. So do/moi and forms very often. Ph. 35-6:
e)/kpwma . . . | texnh/mat(a).
AESCHYL. Ag. 1265: skh=ptra. P. V. 909-10: e)k turanni/dos qro/nwn te .
PIND. O. 3.28: a)ggeli/ais *eu)rusqe/os. Ibid. 7.29: e)k qala/mwn *mide/as. P. 3.26: le/ktroisin. Ibid. 4.242: *fri/cou ma/xairai. Ibid. 9.29: e)k mega/rwn. N. 3.43: *filu/ras e)n do/mois.
HOM. Od. 3.476: a(/rmat(a). 5.6: e)n dw/masi nu/mfhs. 8.268: e)n *(hfai/stoio do/moisin. 21.424-5: e)ni\ mega/roisin . . . | h(/menos.

Il. 3.17: kampu/la to/ca, bow; t. also bow and arrows. 5.745: o)/xea (always in plural in Homer). 14.238: dw_ra de/ toi dw/sw kalo\n qro/non, and so dw=ra elsewhere. 18.141: dw/mata patro/s. 22.503: eu(/desk' e)n le/ktroisin. 24.455: klhi=da qura/wn, but v. 453: qu/rhn. However, qu/rai is usually to be translated as folding-doors. pu/lai, gate, is always plural in Homer.
The plural is sometimes used for the singular as a more courtly or reserved mode of expression.

EUR. Andr. 403: foneu=sin *(/ektoros numfeu/omai. Hec. 402-3: kai\ su\ pai= *laerti/ou, | xa/la tokeu=sin (sc. *(eka/bh|) ei)ko/tws qumoume/nois. I. A. 1015: i(ke/teu) e)kei=non prw=ta mh\ ktei/nein te/kna (sc. *)ifige/neian).

SOPH. O. T. 1184-5: pe/fasmai . . . cu\n oi(=s (sc. th=| mhtri/)
t'
ou) xrh=n o(milw=n ou(/s (sc. to\n pate/ra) te/ m' ou)k e)/dei ktanw/n.
PIND. P. 3.66: e)sloi=si parasxei=n a)ndra/sin (sc. *(ie/rwni).

p.hi: First person plural for the first person singular.

div2.p: The use of the first person plural for the first person singular is due to modesty, which readily becomes affectation. The particular is sunk in the generic, the individual in the class, the woman in her male kindred. It occurs less frequently in Greek than in the more rhetorical Latin.

ISOC. [1]ISOC., 11: e)pili/poi d' a)\n h(ma=s o( pa=s xro/nos, ei) pa/sas ta\s e)kei/nou pra/ceis katariqmhsai/meqa . . . dhlw/somen . . . e)cenhno/xamen. 5.105: fobou=mai mh/ tines e)pitimh/swsin h(mi=n ei) . . . tolmw/|hn soi\ parainei=n, and so often to avoid hiatus. 12.42: tou\s me\n ou)=n palaiou\s a)gw=nas . . . u(/steron e)rou=men (no hiatus), nu=n de\ poih/somai . . . tou\s lo/gous.
XEN. Cyr. 1.1: e)/nnoia/ poq' h(mi=n e)ge/neto , etc. (15 times without change to singular). Mem. 1.2.46.

EUR. Alc. 383 (see 55). Andr. 355-61 (see 55). H. F. 858: h(/lion marturo/mesqa drw=s' a(\ dra=n ou) bou/lomai. Ion, 391: kwluo/mesqa mh\ maqei=n a(\ bou/lomai. Ibid. 1250-1: diwko/mesqa . . . | *puqi/a| yh/fw| krathqei=s), e)/kdotos de\ gi/gnomai. I. A. 823-4 (see 55). Ibid. 1025-6: h)\n d' au)= ti mh\ pra/sswmen w(=n e)gw\ qe/lw (Klytaemestra), | pou= s' au)=qis o)yo/mesqa; (to Achilles). Med. 314-315 (see 55).
SOPH. Ant. 926 (see 55). El. 399 (ibid.). Tr. 491-2 (ibid.).
See comm. on P. 4.27.

HOM. Od. 16.44-5:
h(=so, cei=n): h(mei=s de\ kai\ a)/lloqi dh/omen e(/drhn
staqmw=| e)n h(mete/rw| .
Il. 3.440. Ibid. 13.257-8: to/ nu ga\r katea/camen, o(\ pri\n e)/xeskon, | a)spi/da *dhifo/boio balw/n (Meriones speaks). Ibid. 21.60-1.

p.hi: Gender of the first person plural for the singular.

div2.p: The gender of the plural attribute in examples of the foregoing section is the masculine. The masculine is the generic.

EUR. Alc. 383: a)rkou=men h(mei=s (Alkestis) oi( proqnh/|skontes se/qen. Andr. 355-361: h(mei=s (Andromache)
ga\r ei) sh\n pai=da farmakeu/omen
kai\ nhdu\n e)camblou=men, w(s au)th\ le/gei,
e(ko/ntes ou)k a)/kontes ou)de\ bw/mioi
pi/tnontes au)toi\ th\n di/khn u(fe/comen
e)n soi=si gambroi=s, oi(=sin ou)k e)la/ssona
bla/bhn o)fei/lw prostiqei=s' a)paidi/an.
h(mei=s me\n ou)=n toioi/de: (Notice change to sing. and fem. sing. attribute.) Cf. I, A. 823-4:
ou) qau=ma/ s' h(ma=s (Klytaemestra) a)gnoei=n, oi(=s mh\ pa/ros
prosh=kes . Med. 314-5: kai\ ga\r h)dikhme/noi (sc. Medea) | sighso/mesqa, kreisso/nwn nikw/menoi.

SOPH. Ant. 926: paqo/ntes a)\n cuggnoi=men (sc. Antigone) h(marthko/tes , (Only) when I have met my doom, shall I awake to consciousness of sin.
El. 399: pesou/meq' (sc. Electra), ei) xrh/, patri\ timwrou/menoi , I'll fall, if fall I must, avenger to my father.
Tr. 491-2:
kou)/toi no/son g' e)pakto\n e)carou/meqa
qeoi=si dusmaxou=ntes
(sc. Deïaneira).
The singular is sometimes used in a collective sense.
LYCURG.79: tri/a ga/r e)stin e)c w(=n h( politei/a sune/sthken, o( a)/rxwn, o( dikasth/s, o( i)diw/ths.
XEN. An. 1.7.10: a)riqmo\s e)ge/neto tw=n me\n *(ellh/nwn a)spi\s muri/a kai\ tetrakosi/a . Oec. 21.8: mega/lh| xeiri/ .

THUC.2.4.2: li/qois te kai\ kera/mw|. 3.89.4: ku/matos e)panaxw/rhsis . 3.96.3: pollh=| xeiri/ . 4.10.3: to\n pole/mion deino/teron e(/comen . 4.90.2: a)/mpelon ko/ptontes . . . kai\ li/qous a(/ma kai\ pli/nqon . . . kaqairou=ntes . 5.10.9: h( *xalkidikh\ i(/ppos . 6.24.3: o( de\ polu\s o(/milos kai\ stratiw/ths .

HDT.1.80: th=| de\ kamh/lw| e(/pesqai. 1.174: pollh=| xeiri/ (sim. elsewhere). 5.30: o)ktakisxili/hn a)s pi/da. 7.193: to\ ku=ma. 8.113: th
 i(/ppon th
 xili/hn . . . th
 a)/llhn i(/ppon.
AR. Ran. 1466: o( dikasth/s .

EUR. Heracl. 275-6: pollh
 . . . alxmh/n. Ibid. 337: pollh=| . . . xeiri/. Ibid. 1035: xeri/. Med. 86: pa=s tis au(to
 tou= pe/las (his neighbor) ma=llon filei= (as in English). Phoen. 78: pollh
 . . . a)spi/d(a). Ibid. 441-2:
muri/an a)/gwn
lo/gxhn . fr. 243 N2: o)li/gon a)/lkimon do/ru.
SOPH. O. C. 1251: da/kruon .
AESCHYL. fr. 304.7 N2: sta/xus (sim. elsewhere in tragedy).
PIND. O. 7.19: *)argei/a| su\n ai)xma=|.
HOM. Od. 1.162: ku=ma .

Il. 4.422: ku=ma, and sim. elsewhere. In 5.490: nu/ktas te kai\ h)=mar, and elsewhere, h)=mar is an adverbial expression. 16.11: da/kruon (more than one tear is shed, as is shown by da/krua qerma\ xe/wn w(/s te krh/nh mela/nudros, v. 3), and sim. da/kruon elsewhere in Il. and Od.

Those Nations whose names are thus used are chiefly barbaric despotisms (“as one man”): o( *pe/rshs, the Persian; o( *ludo/s, the Lydian (“the Hivite and the Hittite”); o( *makedw/n ( DEM. in contempt). Thucydides, however, o( *)aqhnai=os, the Athenian; o( *surako/sios, the Syracusan.
DEM. 1.23: to/n ge *pai/ona kai\ to\n *)illurio/n .
THUC.1.69.5: to/n te ga\r *mh=don, and elsewhere. 6.78.1: to\n me\n *surako/sion . . . tw=| *)aqhnai/w| . 6.84.3: o( *xalkideu/s .

HDT.1.69: to
 *(/ellhna. 8.2: o( *la/kwn(?) 8.136: to
 *)aqhnai=on. 9.12: to
 *spartih/thn.
AR. Pax, 214: nu=n w(ttiki/wn dwsei= di/kan .
But the National Appellative with the article is often used of the king, the ruler, the general, and in some instances it is doubtful whether the nation en masse or its representatives are meant.
AESCHIN.2.74: th=s e)n *salami=ni pro\s to\n *pe/rshn (*ce/rchn) naumaxi/as, to be compared with § 75: th\n . . . e)n *plataiai=s pro\s tou\s *pe/rsas pezomaxi/an.
DEM. [7]DEM., 6: para\ tou= *makedo/nos, Philip. [17]DEM., 10 sqq.: o( *makedw/n, Alexander.

XEN. An. 1.2.12 sqq.: h( *ki/lissa , The Cilician queen.
Cyr. 1.1.4: o( *sku/qhs . . . o( *qra=|c . . . o( *)illurio/s . Ibid. 2.1.5: o( *)assu/rios , and elsewhere. Ibid. 3.3.2: h( gunh\ tou= *)armeni/ou , and so o( *)arme/nios and forms often in Xenophon's Cyropaedia.
HDT.1.141 and elsewhere: o( *ludo/s=Croesus. 7.173: o( *makedw/n. 8.108: o( *pe/rshs and to\n *pe/rshn, and so elsewhere.
On the distributive use of the singular, see 43.

p.hi: ei)pe/, fe/re, a)/ge, etc., used in addressing more than one.

div2.p: ei)pe/, say, is often used in fervid or familiar address when several are spoken to; the eye of the speaker shifts. Compare also the interjectional use of fe/re, a)/ge, with a plural verb.
h)\ bou/lesq), ei)pe/ moi, periio/ntes au(tw=n punqa/nesqai, le/getai/ ti kaino/n; DEM.4.10(and similarly elsewhere).
DEM.4.10(see above). 20.21: o(/ra d' ou(twsi/ (addressed to the judges). 25.73: fe/re dh\ pro\s qew=n ka)kei=no ske/yasqe, and sim. fe/re elsewhere in DEM. and other orators.
PLATO, Theaet. 151E: a)lla\ fe/re dh\ au)to\ koinh=| skeyw/meqa, and similarly elsewhere. Prot. 311 D: ei)pe/ moi, w)= *sw/krate/s te kai\ *(ippo/krates, and similarly elsewhere
XEN. Apol. 14: a)/ge dh\ a)kou/sate kai\ a)/lla , and similarly elsewhere.
HDT.1.97: fe/re sth/swmen, but 4.127: fe/rete . . . peira=sqe.

AR. Ach. 319: ei)pe/ moi, ti/ feido/mesqa tw=n li/qwn, w)= dhmo/tai; and similarly elsewhere. Pax, 1115: a)/ge dh/, qeatai/, deu=ro susplagxneu/ete , similarly elsewhere. Ran. 1417: fe/re, pu/qesqe/ mou tadi/ , similarly elsewhere.
EUR. Cycl. 590-1: a)/ge dh/, *dionu/sou pai=des . . . | e)/ndon me\n a(nh/r.
SOPH. Tr. 1255: a)/g' e)gkonei=t', ai)/resqe.
AESCHYL. Pers. 140 sqq.: a)ll' a)/ge, *pe/rsai . . . qw/meqa, et sim. alib.; but Cho. 803-4: a)/gete . . . | lu/sasq(e).
PIND. P. 1.60: a)/g' . . . e)ceu/rwmen.
HOM. Od. 2.212=4.669: a)ll' a)/ge moi do/te , similarly elsewhere; but 22.252: a)/geq' . . . a)konti/sat' , similarly elsewhere.
Il. 2.331: a)ll' a)/ge mi/mnete , similarly elsewhere.

div2.head: ei)=nai and gi/gnomai
div2.p: When the predicate is not in the form of a verb, but in the form of an adjective or substantive or equivalent, the socalled copula is generally employed to couple the adjective or substantive with the subject. The most common forms of the copula are the verbs ei)mi/, I am, and gi/gnomai, I become, turn out, prove, behave.
ei)mi/:
qa/natos h( zhmi/a e)sti/, LYS.13.69 ; The penalty is death. ou(=toi a)ndrei=oi/ ei)sin, PLATO, Lach. 195C; These are brave. So everywhere.
gi/gnomai:
to/ t' a)se/bhma h(me/teron gi/gnetai, ANT. 2 a 3 ; The impiety becomes ours.
LYS.1.7: pa/ntwn tw=n kakw=n a)poqanou=sa ai)ti/a moi gege/nhtai .
ANT. 1.4: ou(=toi tou= me\n teqnew=tos fonh=s gege/nhntai, e)moi\ d' a)nti/dikoi kaqesta=si . 2 a 3 (see above).

cit.quote: katage/lastoi gego/namen e)gw/ te . . . kai\ u(mei=s.

div2.p: XEN. Ag. 10.4: basileu\s e)ge/neto (sc. *)aghsi/laos). (See 64.)
THUC.3.2.3: *tene/dioi . . . mhnutai\ gi/gnontai , The Tenedians turn informers.
HDT.8.86: h)=sa/n ge kai\ e)ge/nonto tau/thn th\n h(me/rhn makrw=| a)mei/nones au)toi\ e(wutw=n , They were really and showed themselves that day to be far better than their wont.
AR. Vesp.207: strou=qos a(nh\r gi/gnetai , The man turns to a sparrow.
SOPH. O. C. 272: ou)d' a)\n w(=d' e)gigno/mhn kako/s . 615: ta\ terpna\ pikra\ gi/gnetai kau)=qis fi/la .

cit.quote: eu)dai/mwn . . . ou(=tos a)nh\r gi/netai (approves himself) sofoi=s.

div2.p:
MIMN. fr. 5.4-5:
a)ll' o)ligoxro/nion gi/gnetai w(/sper o)/nar
h(/bh timh/essa .
HOM. Od. 4.361-2: oi(/ (sc. ou)=roi pnei/ontes) r(a/ te nhw=n pomph=es gi/gnontai . 708-9: ai(/ q' a(lo\s i(/ppoi a)ndra/si gi/gnontai.

Periphrases with gi/gnomai are especially common in elevated style. In addition to the pomp (o)/gkos) gained by the fuller expression, the moral character of the agent or action is brought more distinctly to the consciousness. swth\r genou= moi, AESCH. Cho. 2 , is much more than sw=so/n me, r(usi/polis genou=, Sept. 130 , than r(u=sai th\n po/lin, and mh\ . . . u(bristh\s ge/nh|, SOPH. Ai. 1091-2 , than mh\ u(bri/sh|s. See further the comm. on ANT. 1.2: timwrou\s gene/sqai , and THUC. 3.2.3, and compare Periphrastic Tenses, especially 293.
Strictly speaking, the copula is itself a predicate, as is not unfrequently shown by the translation when it stands alone or with an adverb.
ei) tau=q' ou(/tws e)sti/n, Dem. [58]Dem., 16; If matters stand thus. h( d' e(te/ra e)/stin e)/ti, AND.1.120; The other (daughter) is still living.
DEM.20.64: tou/twn d' i)/sws e)/nioi tw=n a)ndrw=n ou)ke/t' ei)si/n. a)lla\ ta\ e)/rga ta\ praxqe/nt' e)/stin, e)peidh/per a(/pac e)pra/xqh. [58]DEM., 16(see above).

LYS.1.4.
Ibid. 11: o( ga\r a)/nqrwpos e)/ndon h)=n . 13.44: a)na/gkh d' e)sti/n . Ibid. 83: peri\ w(=n e)stin h( ai)ti/a . 19.11: h(\ (sc. spa/nis a)rguri/ou) nu=n e)stin (prevails) e)n th=| po/lei .
AND.1.120(see above).

PLATO, Charm. 153B: ma/xh e)gego/nein (had taken place) e)n th=| *poteidai/a|. Protag. 325 B: ske/yai w(s qaumasi/ws gi/gnontai (act, behave) oi( a)gaqoi/ (see the commentators, and comp. THUC.3.10.1, below). Ibid. 335 D: e)a\n ga\r su\ e)ce/lqh|s, ou)x o(moi/ws h(mi=n e)/sontai oi( dia/logoi, If YOU go out, our discussions will not go on as well.

cit.quote: e)/sti tis ou(/tws a)/frwn o(/stis oi)/etai;

p.gloss:
BreathesCf. PIND. N.6.2-3:
e)k mia=s de\ pne/omen (we have our breath = we have our being)
matro\s a)mfo/teroi
. there the man who is so foolish as to think?

div2.p:
THUC.3.10.1: ei) mh\ met' a)reth=s dokou/shs e)s a)llh/lous gi/gnointo . 4.110.2: ou)/shs th=s po/lews pro\s lo/fon , The city lying uphill.
4.118.10: ai( de\ spondai\ e)niauto\n e)/sontai (are to last).
AR. Eq. 1027: e)moi\ ga/r e)st' o)rqw=s peri\ tou/tou tou= kuno/s .

EUR. Alc. 1076: ou)k e)/sti tou\s qano/ntas ei)s fa/os molei=n. Bacch. 773-4:
oi)/nou de\ mhke/t' o)/ntos ou)k e)/stin *ku/pris
ou)d' a)/llo terpno\n ou)de\n a)nqrw/pois e)/ti
. fr. 236 N2: su\n muri/oisi ta\ kala\ gi/gnetai po/nois.
SOPH. Ph. 1241: e)/stin tis, e)/stin o(/s se kwlu/sei to\ dra=n.
SOLON, 13.16 Bgk4: ou) ga\r dh\n qnhtoi=s u(/brios e)/rga pe/lei.
HOM. Od. 19.312: w(s e)/setai/ per, How things will turn out. 21.212.

HOM. Il. 1.211: w(s e)/setai/ per. 1.564: ei) d' ou(/tw tou=t' e)sti/n. 4.319: w(\s e)/men. 6.130-1: ou)de\ . . . dh\n h)=n . 9.528: w(s h)=n, How it was. 9.551: to/fra de\ *kourh/tessi kakw=s h)=n, fared ill. 11.762: w(\s e)/on. 23.643: w(/s pot' e)/on.
ei)=nai at the head of a sentence or clause is regularly emphatic, and e)/sti is equivalent to the later o)/ntws e)/sti, is really, is in fact.
DEM.20.18: e)/sti de\ tou=q' ou(twsi\ me\n a)kou=sai lo/gon tin) e)/xon.
LYS.1.16: e)/sti d', e)/fh, *)eratosqe/nhs *oi)/hqen o( tau=ta pra/ttwn .
PLATO, Gorg. 449B: ei)si\ me/n, w)= *s., e)/niai tw=n a)pokri/sewn a)nagkai=ai dia\ makrw=n tou\s lo/gous polei=sqai.
XEN. Cyr. 1.4.3: kai\ h(=n me\n i)/sws polulogw/teros .
THUC.7.1.4: w)\n ou)k a)du/natos.
HDT.5.124: h)=n ga\r . . . *)aristago/rhs o( *milh/sios yuxh\n ou)k a)/kros. 8.86: h)=sa/n ge kai\ e)ge/nonto . . . a)mei/nones au)toi\ e(wutw=n (see 60).
AR. Lys. 1037: w(s e)ste\ qwpikai\ fu/sei .
SOPH. O. C. 1000: ei)= ga\r ou) di/kaios . O. T. 255: ei) ga\r h)=n to\ pra=gma mh\ qeh/laton.
PIND. O. 1.36: e)/sti d' a)ndri\ fa/men e)oiko\s a)mfi\ daimo/nwn kala/.
SAPPHO, fr. 85: e)/sti moi ka/la pa/is.

HOM. Od. 2.292-3:
ei)si\ de\ nh=es
pollai\ e)n . . . *)iqa/kh| .

Il. 10.378-9:
e)/sti ga\r e)/ndon
xalko/s .

div2.head: Other verbs
div2.p:
Other Copulative Verbs are:
a)kou/ein,
diatelei=n,
du/nasqai,
kaqi/stasqai = gi(gnesqai (often in orators)
kurei=n, chance,
lagxa/nein,
me/nein, remain,
pe/lein, pe/lesqai,
tele/qein,
tugxa/nein, happen,
u(pa/rxein, be (a basis),
fai/nomai, appear,
fu=nai, comp. fuisse,
etc.

In the better days of the language such verbs as kaqi/stasqai, tugxa/nein, u(pa/rxein, and fu=nai are not mere fluxes for the predicate. The frequent use of fu=nai and tugxa/nein arises from the Greek division of all manifestation into the two spheres of fu/sis and tu/xh. In u(pa/rxein, which ultimately became colorless, the idea of a basis, of something to fall back upon, of resource or residue, was not wholly effaced in the good period.
DEM.18.46: a)nti\ ga\r fi/lwn kai\ ce/nwn a(\ to/t' w)noma/zonto, nu=n ko/lakes kai\ qeoi=s e)xqroi\ kai\ pa/nq) a(\ prosh=ken a)kou/ousin, hear=are called. 57.47: ei) me\n e)/laxon i(ereu/s.
LYS. [6], 4: a)\n nuni\ *)andoki/dhs a)qw=|os a)pallagh=| . . . kai\ la/xh| basileu/s .
ANT. 1.4(60): e)moi\ d' a)nti/dikoi kaqesta=si.

PLATO, Charm. 154B: sxedo\n ga/r ti/ moi pa/ntes oi( e)n th=| h(liki/a| kaloi\ fai/nontai. Ibid. 154 C: kai\ to/te e)kei=nos e)moi\ qaumasto\s e)fa/nh. Hipp. Mai. 300 A: ou)de/ g' au)= h( di) a)koh=s h(donh/, . . . dia\ tau=ta tugxa/nei kalh/. Prot. 313 E: tugxa/neis e)pisth/mwn. Theaet. 146 A: o( de\ a(martw/n . . . kaqedei=tai . . . o)/nos, The fellow that misses will sit down an ass.
XEN. Ages. 10.4: filotimo/tatos de\ pefukw/s, a)h/tthtos diete/lesen, e)pe basileu\s e)ge/neto , Born ambitious, he continued unconquered after he became king.
THUC.4.69.2: kai\ ai( oi)ki/ai . . . au)tai\ u(ph=rxon e)/ruma, The houses themselves served as a fortress.
HDT.4.110: du/natai de\ to\ ou)/noma tou=to kata\ *(ella/da glw=ssan a)ndrokto/noi.
AR. Pax, 1045: ti/s a)/ra pot' e)sti/n; w(s a)lazw\n fai/netai .

EUR. Hec. 1229: u(ph=rx(e). Ion, 412: metape/soi (sc. ta\ sumbo/laia) belti/ona. Med. 229: ka/kistos a)ndrw=n e)kbe/bhx' ou(mo\s po/sis. Ibid. 285: pe/fukas. Ibid. 728: menei=s a)/sulos. fr. 360.8 N2: e)fumen. fr. 382 N2: pe/fuka.

SOPH. El. 45-6:
o(\ ga\r
me/gistos au)toi=s tugxa/nei doruce/nwn .
AESCHYL. Pers. 598: kakw=n me\n o(/stis e)/mpeiros kurei=.
PIND. O. 1.47: w(s d' a)/fantos e)/peles.

HOM. Od. 7.51-2:
qarsale/os ga\r a)nh\r e)n pa=sin a)mei/nwn
e)/rgoisin tele/qei .

Il. 1.417-8:
nu=n d' a(/ma t' w)ku/moros kai\ o)i+zuro\s peri\ pa/ntwn
e)/pleo .

Passive verbs of making, taking, choosing, calling, and the like are used as copulative verbs, and like the others take the same case in the subject and predicate. Such verbs are:
ai(rei=sqai,
ai)/resqai,
a(li/skesqai,
a)podei/knusqai,
au)ca/nesqai,
gignw/skesqai,
dhlou=ssqai,
eu(ri/skesqai,
i(/stasqai,
kaqi/stasqai (cf. 64),
kalei=sqai,
katalei/pesqai,
kri/nesqai,
lamba/nesqai,
le/gesqai,
nomi/zesqai,
o)noma/zesqai,
poiei=sqai,
tetu/xqai, tuxqh=nai,
u(polamba/nesqai,
xeirotonei=sqai, and others.

DEM.2.5: me/gas hu)ch/qh. 2.8: h)/rqh me/gas. 4.18: i(/n(a) . . . a)fu/laktos lhfqh=|. 9. 21: me/gas e)k mikrou= . . . *fi/lippos hu)/chtai. [12]DEM., 14: e)a
 me
 e)mh\ gnwsqh=| (sc. h( nh=sos) . . ., e)a
 d' u(mete/ra kriqh=|. 18.282: su\ toi/nun ou(=tos hu(re/qhs. 27.63: ei) katelei/fqhn me
 e)niau/sios. Ibid. 64: oi)=koi talantiai=oi kai\ dita/lantoi kataleifqe/ntes.
ISOC.12.5: ou)x oi(=o/s ei)mi gignwsko/menos a)lla\ toiou=tos u(polambano/menos oi(=on kte(.
LYS.13.66: kai\ e)lh/fqh moixo/s . 16.8: pollou\s d' au)tw=n strathgou\s kai\ i(ppa/rxous kexeirotonhme/nous .
ANT. 6.11: e)peidh\ xorhgo\s katesta/qhn.

PLATO, Legg. 689D: h( . . . megi/sth tw=n cumfwniw=n megi/sth dikaio/tat' a)\n le/goito sofi/a. Phaedr. 236 B: sfurh/latos e)n *)olumpi/a| sta/qhti. Rpb. 566 D: tu/rannos a)nti\ prosta/tou a)potetelesme/nos.
XEN. An. 7.1.26: pole/mioi me\n e)so/meqa a)podedeigme)noi *lakedaimoni/ois .

THUC.3.82.4: to/lma me\n ga\r a)lo/gistos a)ndri/a file/tairos e)nomi/sqh, Daring without reflection was considered bravery of good comradeship.
5.95: to\ de\ mi=sos duna/mews para/deigma toi=s a)rxome/nois dhlou/menon . 6.33.3: a)/fraktoi lhfqh/sesqe .
HDT.2.141: kai\ nu=n ou(=tos o( basileu\s e(/sthke . . . li/qinos. 3.88: *darei=os . . . basileu\s a)pede/dekto, et sim. alibi.
AR. Nub. 1079: moixo\s ga\r h)\n tu/xh|s a(lou/s . Av. 798-9: *diitre/fhs . . . h(|re/qh fu/larxos, ei)=q' i(/pparxos .
EUR. H. F. 150: su\ d' w(s a)ri/stou fwto\s e)klh/qhs da/mar.

AESCHYL. Eum. 353: palleu/kwn de\ pe/plwn a)/moiros mou/na e)tu/xqhn. Pers.135-9: *persi/des d' . . . e(ka/sta . . . lei/petai mono/zuc. Sept. 698-9: kako\s ou) keklh/- | sh|, Base shalt thou not be called.
PIND. O. 9.46: *laoi\ d' o)nu/masqen. I. 3.25-6: tima/entes . . . le/gontai | pro/cenoi/ t(e).
HOM. Od. 9.335: au)ta\r e)gw\ pe/mptos meta\ toi=sin e)le/gmhn . 20.67-8: ai(\ de\ li(ponto o)rfanai\ e)n mega/roisi .
Il. 1.293: h)= ga/r ken deilo/s te kai\ ou)tidano\s kaleoi/mhn. 4.84: *zeu/s, o(/s t' a)nqrw/pwn tami/hs pole/moio te/tuktai.

p.hi: ei)=nai combined with a copulative verb.

div2.p: Even after these ei)=nai is sometimes found as to be is in English; e. g. “Paul called to be an apostle.”
ISAE. Cf. 2.41: ou(= ei)=nai w)noma/sqhn.
PLATO. Cf. Apol. 23 A: o)/noma de\ tou=to le/gesqai sofo\s ei)=nai . Rpb. 428 E: o(/soi e)pisth/mas e)/xontes o)noma/zontai/ tines ei)=nai .
HDT.5.25(ter). 7.154: a)pede/xqh pa/shs th=s i(/ppou ei)=nai i(/pparxos.
PIND. O. 10.63-4: ma/trwos d' e)ka/lesse/ nin | i)sw/numon e)/mmen.
Cf. Il. 17.150-1: *sarphdo/n(a) . . . | ka/llipes *)argei+/oisin e(/lwr kai\ ku/rma gene/sqai.
Previous condition is represented by a)nti/ or e)c with the gen.
DIN.1.111: eu(rh/sete ga\r tou=ton . . . a)nti\ me\n logogra/fou . . . plousiw/taton o)/nta tw=n e)n th=| po/lei, a)nti\ d' a)gnw=tos . . . e)/ndocon gegenhme/non.
DEM.9.21: me/gas e)k mikrou= (see 65). 18.46 (see 64). Ibid. 131: plou/sios e)k ptwxou= . . . gegonw/s, A rich man (plutocrat) from a pauper.
LYS.32.17: a)nti\ plousi/wn ptwxou/s .
PLATO, Rpb. 566D (see 65).
XEN. Cyr. 8.3.39: e)k pe/nhtos plou/sios gege/nhsai .
HDT.1.87: pole/mion a)nti\ fi/lou e)moi\ katasth=nai.
Cf. Av. 627 (see 25). Ran. 1011: e)k xrhstw=n kai\ gennai/wn moxqhrota/tous a)pe/deicas.
SOPH. Tr. 148-9: e(/ws tis a)nti\ parqe/nou gunh\ klhqh=| .
PIND. O. 13.66-7: e)c o)nei/rou d au)ti/ka | h)=n u(/par.
On the Double Acc. after Active Verbs see Index.

div1.head: Omission of parts of the simple sentence

div2.head: Omission of the subject
div2.p: The personal pronoun of the first and second person is not expressed unless it is emphatic, as, for example, in contrasts.

ti/ ma=llon e)mou= su\ kathgorei=s h)\ )gw\ sou=; DEM.18.196; Why do you accuse me rather than I you? ou(=tos me\n ga\r u(/dwr, e)gw\ d' oi)=non pi/nw, DEM.19.46; This fellow (drinks) water, I drink wine.
LYS.1.26: ou)k e)gw/ se a)poktenw= a)ll' o( th=s po/lews no/mos , (It is) not I that am about to kill thee, but the law of the state. (Cf. AR. Eccl. 1055-6, cited below).
PLATO, Conv. 172B: su\ ou)=n moi dih/ghsai. Protag. 335 D (see 62).
XEN. An. 1.3.6: a)lla\ e)pei\ u(mei=s e)moi\ ou)k e)qe/lete pei/qesqai, ou)de\ e(/pesqai, e)gw\ su\n u(mi=n e(/yomai .
THUC.6.14: kai\ su/, w)= pru/tani, tau=ta . . . e)piyh/fize .
HDT.6.1: tou=to to\ u(po/dhma e)/rrayas me\n su/, u(pedh/sato de\ *)aristago/rhs. 7.11: ei) h(mei=s h(suxi/hn a)/comen, a)ll' ou)k e)kei=noi.

AR. Vesp. 1426: su\ le/ge . Eccl.1055-6:
a)ll' ou)k e)gw/
a)ll' o( no/mos e(/lkei se
.
EUR. Hec. 609-10: su\ d' au)= labou=sa teu=xos, a)rxai/a la/tri, | . . . e)/negke deu=ro.
SOPH. Antig. 508: su\ tou=to mou/nh tw=nde *kadmei/wn o(ra=|s.
PIND. e)gw/ 27 times, su/ and tu/ together 10 times.
SOLON, fr. 2: ei)/hn dh\ to/t' e)gw\ *folega/ndrios h)\ *sikinh/ths.
HOM. Od. 1.303-5: au)ta\r e)gw\n e)pi\ nh=a qoh\n kateleu/somai h)/dh . . . soi\ d' au)tw=| mele/tw .
Il. 1.76: toiga\r e)gw\n e)re/w, su\ de\ su/nqeo. 2.485-6: u(mei=s . . . pa/reste/ te, i)/ste te pa/nta, | h(mei=s de\ kle/os oi)=on a)kou/omen, ou)de/ ti i)/dmen.

The emphasis of the first and second persons is not to be insisted on too much in poetry or in familiar prose. Notice the frequency of e)gw)=|da, e)gw)=|mai. Noteworthy also is the return of e)gw/ in AESCHIN.3.

p.hi: Omission of the subject of the third person.

div2.p: The personal pronoun of the third person has no nominative. Hence, the unemphatic subject of the third person is omitted when it can be readily supplied from the context.

p.hi: Subject omitted even when there is a sudden change of subjects.

div2.p: So free is the Greek in its omission of the subject that there is often a sudden change of subject without further warning.

cit.quote: h( gunh\ a)ph/|ei . . . w(s to\ paidi/on, i(/na to\n titqo\n au)tw=| didw=| (sc. h( gunh/) kai\ mh\ boa=|

div2.p: XEN. An. 1.2.26: h( gunh\ au)to\n e)/peise kai\ pi/steis e)/labe (sc. *sue/nnesis).

THUC.2.3.4: e)xw/roun (sc. oi( *plataih=s) . . . e)p' au)tou/s (sc. tou\s *qhbai/ous), o(/pws mh\ kata\ fw=s qarsalewte/rois ou)=si prosfe/rwntai (sc. oi( *plataih=s) kai\ sfi/sin e)k tou= i)/sou gi/gnwntai (sc. oi( *qhbai=oi). 3.62.5: e)peidh\ gou=n o(/ te *mh=dos a)ph=lqe kai\ tou\s no/mous e)/labe (sc. h( po/lis). 8.102.1: w(s au)toi=s oi(/ te fruktwroi\ e)sh/mainon kai\ h)|sqa/nonto (sc. oi( *)aqhnai=oi) ta\ pura\ e)cai/fnhs polla\ . . . fane/nta.
SOPH. Ai. 549. Tr. 362-3 (where see Jebb).

PIND. O. 3.20-2:
o)fqalmo\n a)nte/flece *mh/na,
kai\ mega/lwn a)e/qlwn a(gna\n kri/sin . . .
qh=ke
(sc. *(hraklh=s). 9.45-6. P. 4.23-5. So elsewhere.
HES. fr. 5 Rz.: ou)de/ oi( u(/pnos | pi=pten e)pi\ blefa/rois, fulakh\n d' e)/xen (sc. *)/argos) e)/mpedon ai)ei/.

HOM. Il. 23.704-6: a)ndri\ de\ nikhqe/nti gunai=k' e)s me/sson e)/qhken (sc. *phlei+/dhs), | polla\ d' e)pi/stato (sc. h( gunh/) e)/rga, ti/on (sc. *)axaioi/) de/ e( tessara/boion. | sth= d' o)rqo\s kai\ mu=qon e)n *)argei+/oisin e)/eipen (sc. *phlei+/dhs).Note also N. T. Marc. 1.31: kai\ a)fh=ken au)th\n o( pureto\s eu)qe/ws, kai\ dihko/nei (sc. e)kei/nh) au)toi=s .

The subject is sometimes omitted in the third person, when it may be involved in the verb as the definite function of a definite character. e)kh/rucen, he proclaimed (o( kh=ruc), etc. In a suit at law, the clerk is often addressed without any further note. In dramatic passages, a servant is often supposed to be at hand.

a)nagnw/tw (sc. o( grammateu/s), DEM. [44]. 45; Let (the clerk) read.
e)pei\ e)sa/lpigce (sc. o( salpigkth/s), proballo/menoi ta\ o(/pla e)ph=|san, XEN. An. 1.2.17 ; When the trumpet sounded, etc.
DEM. [44]DEM., 45(see above).
LYS.19.27: a(\ de\ kate/lipen (sc. o( *)aristofa/nhs),a)nagnw/setai (sc. o( grammateu/s) u(mi=n . Ibid. 57.

XEN. An. 1.2.17 (see above). 2.2.4: e)peida\n . . . shmh/nh| . 3.4.4: e)sh/mhne . Ibid. 36: e)kh/ruce . 5.2.12: o(po/tan shmh/nh| (twice). 6.5.25: e(/ws shmai/noi . Conv. 5.2: mo/non, e)/fh, to\n lampth=ra e)ggu\s prosenegka/tw . Cyr. 2.2.2: h)/rcato (sc. o( a)/rtamos). 4.5.42: khruca/tw .
THUC.3.21.3: w(/ste pa/rodon mh\ ei)=nai, a)lla\ di) au)tw=n me/swn dih=|san (sc. oi( diio/ntes) = those who had to go through = oi( fu/lakes.
HDT.2.47: e)pea\n qu/sh|. 2.70: e)pea\n . . . delea/sh|.
COM. 3.502: th\n tra/pezan h(=k' e)/xwn (sc. o( dou=los).
PIND. P. 1.48: a(ni/x' eu(ri/skonto qew=n pala/mais tima/n, Hiero cum fratribus.
THEOGN. 473: oi)noxoei/tw.
HOM. Od. 4.214: xeua/ntwn (sc. qera/pontes). 21.142: oi)noxoeu/ei (sc. o( oi)noxo/os).
Il. 18.492-3: nu/mfas . . . | h)gi/neun (sc. numfagwgoi/).

Not essentially different from this use is the use of the so-called qei=a r(h/mata, in which the name of the divine agent is omitted, such as u(/ei (sc. o( u(/wn=*zeu/s), he rains (the rainer =Zeus). So bronta=|, he thunders; ni/fei, he snows; sei/ei, he shakes (Poseidon).
LYS. fr. 75.4 (Sch.): h)/dh suskota/zontos .
THUC.1.51.2: cunesko/taze ga\r h)/dh. 4.52.1: kai\ tou= au)tou= mhno\s i(stame/nou e)/seise .
HDT.2.22: u(=sai . . . e)xio/nize (twice). 4.28: th\n me\n w(rai/hn ou)k u(/ei lo/gou a)/cion ou)de/n, to\ de\ qe/ros u(/wn ou)k a)ni/ei (note the masc. ptc. u(/wn).
AR. Ach. 1141: vi/fei . fr. 2.963.13: kai\ cunne/nofe kai\ xeime/ria bronta=| ma/l' eu)= .
COM. 2.851.2: nife/tw me\n a)lfi/tois, | yakaze/tw d' a)/rtoisin, u(e/tw d' e)/tnei.
No example. See 74.

In Homer the divine agent is always expressed, as it often is in poetry, and even in prose that aims at reproducing the language of the people. That the notion of god is never abandoned is shown by the use of the genitive absolute, and not the accusative absolute. u(/ontos, when it is raining. See Participial Accusative.
XEN. Oec. 8.16: o(/tan xeima/zh| o( qeo\s e)n th=| qala/tth| . Ibid. 20.11: u(/dwr me\n o( a)/nw qeo\s pare/xei . Ven. 8.1: o(/tan ni/fh| o( qeo/s .
HDT.3.117: to\n me\n ga\r xeimw=na u(/ei sfi o( qeo/s. So elsewhere.

AR. Ach. 510-11: kau)toi=s o( *poseidw=n ... sei/sas . . . e)mba/loi ta\s oi)ki/as . Nub. 368: ti/s u(/ei;
Av. 570: bronta/tw nu=n o( me/gas *za/n . Lys. 1142: xw) qeo\s sei/wn a(/ma . So elsewhere.
SOPH. O. C. 1606: ktu/phse me\n *zeu\s xqo/nios .
PIND. O. 7.49-50: o( me\n (sc. *zeu/s) . . . | polu\n u(=se xruso/n. I. 6 (7), 5.
ALCAE. fr. 34: u)/ei me\n o) *zeu/s.
HOM. Od. 14.305: *zeu\s d' a)/mudis bro/nthse.

Il. 9.236-7: *zeu\s de/ sfi *kroni/dhs e)nde/cia sh/mata fai/nwn | a)stra/ptei. 12.25: u(=e d' a)/ra *zeu/s. 12.279-80: o(/te t' w)/reto mhti/eta *zeu\s | nife/men.Note also POLYB. 31.21.9: suskota/zontos a)/rti tou= qeou=.
In the genitive absolute:
LYS. fr. 75.4 (Sch.): h)/dh suskota/zontos.
XEN. Hell. 1.1.16: u(/ontos pollw=| .

AR. Vesp. 773-4:
e)a\n de\ ni/fh|, pro\s to\ pu=r kaqh/menos (sc. h(lia/sei),
u(/ontos, ei)/sei
.Compare also POLYB. 31.21.9 (see above).

The same principle lies at the basis of all so-called impersonal verbs. Sometimes the subject is contained in the predicate, as when the passive is used impersonally, or when the infinitive is used without a subject.
e)moi\ . . . dedih/ghtai, ANTIPHON, 1.31; My tale has been told.
ANTIPHON, 1.31: e)moi\ me\n ou)=n dedih/ghtai kai\ beboh/qhtai tw=| <te> teqnew=ti kai\ tw=| no/mw|. 5.75: o(/mws d' ou)=n kekinduneu/setai.
PLATO, Rpb. 457E. eu)= ma/l' a)\n a)mfisbhthqei/h (cf. ibid. D: a)mfisbh/thsin gene/sqai).

XEN. Hell. 1.3.20: e)pei\ de\ au)toi=s pareskeu/asto . Mem. 1.7.2: a)=r' ou) ta\ e)/cw th=s te/xnhs mimhte/on tou\s a)gaqou\s au)lhta/s; . . . kai\ tou/tw| tau=ta poihte/on . . . kai\ tou/tw| pollou\s e)paine/tas paraskeuaste/on .

THUC.1.46.1: oi( de\ *kori/nqioi, e)peidh\ au)toi=s pareskeu/asto, e)/pleon e)pi\ th\n *ke/rkuran. 1.91.1: teixi/zetai/ te kai\ h)/dh u(/yos lamba/nei (sc. to\ tei=xos). 7.25.9: w(s . . . diapepolemhso/menon . Cf. 7.77.3: i(kana\ ga\r toi=s te polemi/ois hu)tu/xhtai .
Thesm. 1227: a)lla\ pe/paistai metri/ws h(mi=n. Ran. 376: h)ri/sthtai d' e)carkou/ntws.
HOM. Od. 9.143: ou)de\ proufai/net' i)de/sqai. 19.312: a)lla/ moi w(=d' a)na\ qumo\n o)i+/etai, w(s e)/setai/ per.
Il. 22.319: w(\s ai)xmh=s a)pe/lamp' eu)h/keos.
For additional examples of the impersonal passive, see 176.
For the impersonal neuter plural in -te/a, see exx. under 37.

Often the subject is practically an infinitive or a sentence. So in the case of such verbs as dei=, dokei=, ei)se/rxetai/ (ei)sh/|ei, ei)sh=lqe/) me, e)nde/xetai, e)/cestin, e)/stin, e)/xei lo/gon, ou)k e)/stin, pare/xei, pre/pei, prosh/kei, sumfe/rei, fai/netai, xrh/, etc.
a(/panta ga\r dei= ta)lhqh= le/gein, LYS. 3.10 ; It is necessary to tell all the truth, The whole truth must be told.
DEM.19.204: ou)/te ga\r w(s sumfe/rei *fwke/as a)polwle/nai . . . e)/nestin le/gein au)tw=|.
LYS. 3.10: e)/doce/ moi kra/tiston ei)=nai a)podhmh=sai e)k th=s po/lews .
THUC.1.120.1: xrh\ ga\r tou\s h(gemo/nas . . . ta\ koina\ proskopei=n. 1.120.3: eu)= de\ parasxo/n, e)k pole/mou pa/lin cumbh=nai (sc. a)ndrw=n a)gaqw=n e)stin).

HDT.3.71: e)pei/te de\ e)s *darei=on a)pi/keto gnw/mhn a)pofai/nesqai. 3.142: kai/ moi pare/xei nu=n u(me/wn a)/rxein. 6.27: file/eei de/ kws proshmai/nein, eu)=t' a)\n me/llh| mega/la kaka\ h)\ po/li h)\ e)/qnei+ e)/sesqai, but just below: tau=ta me/n sfi shmh/ia o( qeo\s proe/dece. 9.68: dhloi= te/ moi o(/ti pa/nta ta\ prh/gmata tw=n barba/rwn h)/rthto e)k *perse/wn.
EUR. H. F. 302-3: h)/dh d' e)sh=lqe/ m' ei) paraithsai/meqa | fuga\s te/knwn tw=nd(e).
HOM. Od. 1.296-7: ou)d' e)/ti se xrh\ | nhpie/as o)xe/ein. Cf. 3.14: *thle/max), ou) me/n se xrh\ e)/t' ai)do/os. 8. 146: e)/oike de/ s' i)/dmen a)e/qlous.
Il. 2.24: ou) xrh\ pannu/xion eu(/dein boulhfo/ron a)/ndra. 9.337-8: ti/ de\ dei=The only instance of dei= in Homer.polemize/menai *trw/essin *)argei+/ous;
For other examples, see 37, and on the infinitive, see Index.
78. Sometimes an indefinite subject is to be supplied from the context. This is very easy in the dependencies of the infinitive, as that form always involves an indefinite accusative subject.
ISAE. 2.13: [o( no/mos] keleu/ei ta\ e(autou= e)cei=nai diaqe/sqai o(/pws a)\n e)qe/lh|. So elsewhere.

ANTIPHON, 5.91: e)n me\n ga\r a)kestw=| pra/gmati kai\ o)rgh=| xrhsame/nous kai\ diabolh=| piqome/nous e)/lasson e)/stin e)camartei=n: metagnou\s ga\r e)/ti a)\n o)rqw=s bouleu/saito (sc. o( . . . xrhsa/menos kte().

PLATO, Men. 97A: ou)k e)/stin o)rqw=s h(gei=sqai, e)a\n mh\ fro/nimos h)=|. So elsewhere. Cf. Rpb. 347 C: th=s de\ zhmi/as megi/sth to\ u(po\ ponhrote/rou a)/rxesqai, e)a\n mh\ au)to\s e)qe/lh| a)/rxein.

HDT.1.195: e)sqh=ti de\ toih=|de xre/wntai, kiqw=ni podhneke/i line/w|, kai\ e)pi\ tou=ton a)/llon ei)ri/neon kiqw=na e)pendu/nei (sc. o( xrew/menos). 1.216: ou)=ros de\ h(liki/hs sfi proke/etai a)/llos me
 ou)dei/s: e)pea
 de\ ge/rwn ge/nhtai ka/rta kte(. 2.38: dokima/zousi . . . h)
 . . . i)/dhtai (sc. o( dokima/zwn). 2.65: eu)xo/menoi . . . i(sta=si . . . didoi= (sc. o( eu)xo/menos).
EUR. Or. 428: misou/meq' ou(/tws w(/ste mh\ prosenne/pein (sc. tina/).
HOM. Od. 5.400: o(/sson (o(/son) te ge/gwne boh/sas(?). 6.294: id. 9.473: id. 12.181: id.
Il. 13.287: ou)de/ ken e)/nqa teo/n ge me/nos kai\ xei=ras o)/noito, a fault-finder. 22.199: w(s (= as) d' e)n o)nei/rw| ou) du/natai feu/gonta diw/kein, a dreamer.
Other ellipses of Time, Circumstances, and the like coincide with the English.

th=s d' w(/ras e)gi/gnet' o)ye/, DEM. 21.84 ; It was getting late.
h)=n pro\s h(me/ran, LYS. 1.14 ; It was drawing on towards day.
PLATO, Conv. 217D: skhpto/menos o(/ti o)ye\ ei)/h.
XEN. An. 1.8.1: h)/dh te h)=n a)mfi\ a)gora\n plh/qousan . Ap. 23: e)/nqa ou) prosbato\n qana/tw| . Hell. 1.6.20: e)pei\ sko/tos ei)/h, e)cebi/bazen . . . e)peidh\ h)/dh me/son h(me/ras h)=n .

THUC.1.109.3: w(s de\ au)tw=| ou) prouxw/rei, matters.
2.56.1: e)peidh\ e(toi=ma h)=n , things.
2.56.4: e)s e)lpi/da me\n h)=lqon tou= e(lei=n, ou) me/ntoi proexw/rhse/ ge . 4.93.1: h)/dh ga\r kai\ th=s h(me/ras o)ye\ h)=n . 7.84.4: e)s ta\ e)pi\ qa/tera/ te tou= potamou= parasta/ntes oi( *surako/sioi (h)=n de\ krhmnw=des [sc. to\ xwri/on]).
HDT.3.82: e)k de\ tou= fo/nou a)pe/bh e)s mounarxi/hn.
HOM. Il. 22.410: tw=| de\ ma/list' a)/r' e)/hn (the situation) e)nali/gkion, w(s ei) kte(.
See also exx. under 37.
One may be expressed by tis, or, chiefly in phrases, by the Ideal second person, an imaginary you.
tis:
DEM.1.21: fh/seie/ tis a)/n. 3.10: ei)/poi tis a)/n, and so elsewhere. 4.25: ei) ga\r e)/roito/ tis u(ma=s. 18.252: pantaxo/qen me\n toi/nun a)/n tis i)/doi.
PLATO, Legg. 905C. PLAT. Soph. 220D: h)\ ti/ tis a)/n, *qeai/thte, ei)/poi ka/llion; and so elsewhere.
XEN. An. 1.9.3: katama/qoi a)/n tis , and elsewhere.
THUC.1.6.6: polla\ d' a)\n kai\ a)/lla tis a)podei/ceie kte(., and elsewhere.
HDT.1.32: e)n ga\r tw=| makrw=| xro/nw| polla\ me/n e)sti i)dei=n ta\ mh/ tis e)qe/lei.
AR. Pax, 833: a)ste/res gigno/meq', o(/tan tis a)poqa/nh| .

SOPH. O. C. 1536-7:
qeoi\ ga\r eu)= me/n, o)ye\ d' ei)sorw=s', o(/tan
ta\ qei=) a)fei)s tis ei)s to\ mai/nesqai traph=|
. Ph. 505: xw)/tan tis eu)= zh=| , and so often.
HOM. Od. 4.535 = 11.411: w(/s ti/s te kate/ktane bou=n e)pi\ fa/tnh|.
Il. 3.33: w(s d' o(/te ti/s te dra/konta i)dw\n pali/norsos a)pe/sth, and so elsewhere.
PLATO. Protag. 347 D: o(/pou de\ kaloi\ ka)gaqoi\ sumpo/tai kai\ pepaideume/noi ei)si/n, ou)k a)\n i)/dois ou)/t' au)lhtri/das ou)/te kte(. (?).

XEN. Cyr. 8.1.33: e)pe/gnws d' a)
 e)kei= ou)de/na ou)/te o)rgizo/menon kraugh=| ou)/te xai/ronta u(bristikw=s ge/lwti, a)lla\ i)dw
 a)
 au)tou\s h(gh/sw tw=| o)/nti ei)s ka/llos zh=n . Ibid. 8.3.42: o)/yei (?). Ibid. 8.3.43: ou)de/na a)
 i)/dois (?). Hell. 6.4.16: w(=n de\ zw=ntes h)ggelme/noi h)=san (sc. oi( prosh/kontes)o)li/gous a)
 ei)=des .

HDT.2.29: sxoi=noi de\ duw/deka/ ei)si ou(=toi tou\s dei= tou/tw| tw=| tro/pw| diekplw=sai (which one must . . .). kai\ e)/peita a)pi/ceai e)s (and then you will reach) pedi/on lei=on . . . h(/ceis . . . poih/seai . . . pleu/seai . . . h(/ceis. 2.30: e)n i)/sw| xro/nw| a)/llw| h(/ceis . . . e)n o(/sw| . . . h)=lqes. 4.28: u(/dwr e)kxe/as phlo\n ou) poih/seis, pu=r de\ a)nakai/wn poih/seis phlo/n.
EUR. H. F. 1196: ou)k a)\n ei)dei/hs (?).
SOPH. O. C. 431: ei)/pois a)/n (?).
PIND. P. 10.29: nausi\ d' ou)/te pezo\s i)w\n a)\n eu(/rois.
HOM. Od. 3.124: ou)de/ ke fai/hs.
Il. 4.223: e)/nq' ou)k a)\n bri/zonta i)/dois *)agame/mnona di=on. 4.429: ou)de/ ke fai/hs. 5.85: ou)k a)\n gnoi/hs. 15.697: fai/hs k(e).

p.hi: Indefinite subject of the third person plural omitted.

div2.p: In the third person plural, the indefinite subject may be omitted, chiefly in verbs of saying and thinking.
w(/s fasi, DEM.4.9; As they say, and so elsewhere.
DEM.4.9(see above). 19.193: ei)pei=n dh/ fasi to\n *sa/turon, o(/ti kte(. 19.194: ei)pei=n fasin au)to/n.
PLATO, Legg. 803D: oi)/ontai . . . h(gou=ntai(?) Rpb. 428 B: ou) ga/r pou a)maqi/a| ge a)ll' e)pisth/mh| eu)= bouleu/ontai.
XEN. An. 1.9.5: e)/krinon d' au)to/n .
THUC.7.69.2: o(/per pa/sxousin e)n toi=s mega/lois a)gw=si.
HDT.2.106: th=| te e)k th=s *)efesi/hs e)s *fw/kaian e)/rxontai kai\ th=| e)k *sardi/wn e)s *smu/rnhn.
AR. Pax, 832: a(\ le/gousi .
SOPH. Ph. 335: w(s le/gousin.
PIND. O. 2.31: le/gonti. P. 1.52 and P. 2.21: fanti/.

Il. 4.375: pe/ri d' a)/llwn fasi\ gene/sqai. 18.487: kale/ousin.

div2.head: Omission of the copula.
div2.p: The forms e)sti/ and ei)si/ of the copula are omitted in saws and proverbs, in short statements and questions, rapid transitions, abstract expressions. So regularly with -te/on, a)na/gkh, w(/ra, and the like. Other forms than e)sti/ or ei)si/ more rarely. Cf. also 9.
braxu\s o( e)/legxos (sc. e)sti/n), LYCURG.33; Brief is the proof.
LYCURG.33: a(plou=n to\ di/kaion, r(a/|dion to\ a)lhqe/s, braxu\s o( e)/legxos.
DEM.18.242: ponhro\n . . . ponhro\n o( sukofa/nths.
ANTIPHON, 5.7: h( me\n ou)=n ai)/thsis w)= a)/ndres kai\ nomi/mws kai\ o(si/ws e)/xousa (sc. e)sti/n).

PLATO, Euthyd. 304B: to\ ga\r spa/nion, w)= *eu)q., ti/mion: to\ de\ u(/dwr eu)wno/taton. Euthyphr. 15 E: kai/ moi w(/ra a)pie/nai. Gorg. 507 A: a)na/gkh tau=t' ei)=nai ou(/tws. Phaedr. 245 C: a)rxh\ de\ a)podei/cews h(/de. yuxh\ pa=sa a)qa/natos. to\ ga\r a)eiki/nhton a)qa/naton. Theaet. 144 D (twice). 145 A: skepte/on.

THUC.1.32.5: a)na/gkh (sc. e)sti/n) . . . cuggnw/mh (sc. e)sti/n). 3.82.2. 7.77.7: a)/ndres ga\r po/lis, kai\ ou) tei/xh ou)de\ nh=es a)ndrw=n kenai/ .
HDT.6.129: ou) fronti\s *(ippoklei/dh|.

AR. Ach. 8: a)/cion ga\r *(ella/di . Id. 40: a)ll' oi( pruta/neis ga\r ou(toii\ meshmbrinoi/ (sc. ei)si/n). Id. 41: tou=t' e)kei=n' ou(gw\ 'legon . Nub. 2-3. Id. 207: ai(/de me\n *)aqh=nai (sc. ei)si/n). Ran. 658: badiste/on .
EUR. Hel. 276: ta\ barba/rwn ga\r dou=la pa/nta plh\n e(no/s. Hipp. 436: ai( deu/terai/ pws fronti/des sofw/terai, Sober second thought somehow is best. I. A. 334. fr. 234 N2, etc.
AESCHYL. Suppl. 998: te/rein' o)pw/ra d' eu)fu/laktos ou)damw=s.
PIND. O. 1.34-5: a(me/rai d' e)pi/loipoi | ma/rtures sofw/tatoi (sc. ei)si/n). Ibid. 6.9-11. N. 6.1-2: e(\n a)ndrw=n, | e(\n qew=n ge/nos. Pindar seldom uses the copula.
O. et D. 311: e)/rgon d' ou)de\n o)/neidos, a)ergi/h de/ t' o)/neidos. Ibid. 346: ph=ma kako\s gei/twn. (Common).
HOM. Od. 11.379: w(/rh me\n pole/wn mu/qwn, w(/rh de\ kai\ u(/pnou. Ibid. [456], and elsewhere.

DEM.4.18: ei)dw\s eu)trepei=s u(ma=s (sc. o)/ntas). 4.29: e)gw\ ple/wn e)qelonth\s pa/sxein o(tiou=n e(/toimos (sc. ei)mi/), e)a\n mh\ tau=q' ou(/tws e)/xh|. 18.277: kai/toi e)/gwg' o(rw= th=s tw=n lego/ntwn duna/mews tou\s a)kou/ontas to\ plei=ston kuri/ous (sc. o)/ntas). 19.250: ei)=t' ou) su\ sofisth/s (sc. ei)=); kai\ ponhro/s ge (sc. ei)=). ou) su\ logogra/fos (sc. ei(=); kai\ qeoi=s e)xqro/s ge (sc. ei)=).
ANTIPHON, 1.4: u(mei=s ga/r moi a)nagkai=oi (sc. e)ste/).

PLATO, Rpb. 499D: peri\ tou/tou e(/toimoi (sc. e)sme/n) tw=| lo/gw| diama/xesqai, w(s kte(. Theaet. 143 D: soi\ dh\ ou)k o)li/gistoi plhsia/zousi, kai\ dikai/ws: a)/cios ga\r (sc. ei)=) ta/ te a)/lla kai\ gewmetri/as e(/neka. Ibid. 146 B: e)gw\ me\n ga\r a)h/qhs th=s toiau/ths diale/ktou (sc. ei)mi/), I'm unfamiliar with this style of talk.
THUC.1.23.2: ou)/te fugai\ tosai/de a)nqrw/pwn kai\ fo/nos (sc. e)ge/nonto).
SOPH. O. T. 91-2: ei) tw=nde xrh/|zeis plhsiazo/ntwn klu/ein, | e(/toimos (sc. ei)mi/) ei)pei=n, ei)/te kai\ stei/xein e)/sw.
HOM. Od. 4.206 = 18.126: toi/ou ga\r kai\ patro/s (sc. e)ssi/).

Il. 9.225: xai=r), *)axileu=: daito\s me\n e)i/shs ou)k e)pideuei=s (sc. ei)me/n). 20.434: oi)=da d' o(/ti su\ me\n e)sqlo/s (sc. e)ssi/), e)gw\ de\ se/qen polu\ xei/rwn (sc. ei)mi/). 21.482: xaleph/ toi e)gw\ (sc. ei)mi/) me/nos a)ntife/resqai, and so elsewhere.
a)kou/et' w)= a)/. *)a. th=s e)pistolh=s, w(s kalh\ kai\ fila/nqrwpos (sc. e)sti/n), DEM. 19.39.

LYS.18.11: a)ll' oi(=s ma/lista prosh=kon (sc. h)=n).
PLATO, Rpb. 371A: w(=n a)\n au)toi=s xrei/a (sc. h)=|).
XEN. Apol. 23: e)/nqa ou) prosbato\n (sc. ei)/h) qana/tw| .
THUC.1.32.5: e)peidh\ de\ . . . me/gas o( ki/ndunos (sc. e)sti/n). 2.53.3: o(/ ti de\ h)/dh te h(du/ (sc. h)=n). 2.62.5: h(=s e)n tw=| a)po/rw| (sc. e)sti/n) h( i)sxu/s.
AR. Ach. 19-20: w(s nu=n, o(po/t' ... e)/rhmos (sc. e)sti/n) h( pnu\c au(thi/ .
EUR. Hipp. 659-60: e)/st' a)\n e)/kdhmos xqono\s | *qhseu/s (sc. h)=|).
PIND. O. 1.84: qanei=n d' oi(=sin a)na/gka (sc. e)sti/n). Ibid. 3.42: ei) d' a)risteu/ei me\n u(/dwr, ktea/nwn de\ xruso\s ai)doie/staton (sc. e)sti/n).
HES. O. et D. 40: ou)de\ i)/sasin, o(/sw| ple/on h(/misu panto/s (sc. e)sti/n).
HOM. Od. 15.393-4: ou)de/ ti/ se xrh/, pri\n w(/rh (sc. e)/h|), katale/xqai .

Il. 1.116: ei) to/ g' a)/meinon (sc. e)sti/n). Ibid. 156-7: e)pei\ h)= ma/la polla\ metacu\ | ou)/rea/ te skio/enta (sc. e)sti/n). Ibid. 547: a)ll' o(\n me/n k) e)pieike\s (sc. e)/h|) a)koue/men. 5.480: o(/s k' e)pideuh/s (sc. e)/h|), and so elsewhere. 20.434 (85).

div2.head: Omission of the verbal predicate.
div2.p: As in other languages, so in Greek the verbal predicate may be omitted when it is more or less distinctly suggested by other words in the sentence. This happens most frequently in the case of verbs of Going, Coming, Doing, Happening, Saying. There seems to be no ellipsis of a definite word in examples of this kind.
LYCURG.119: ti/ dokou=sin u(mi=n, w)= a)/ndres (sc. poiei=n?); a)=ra/ ge o(moi/ws u(mi=n peri\ tw=n a)dikou/ntwn gignw/skein;
DEM.24.187: kai\ peri\ me\n tou/tou kata\ sxolh/n (sc. e)rw=?). [56]DEM., 50: deu=ro (sc. i)/qi?), *dhmo/sqenes.

ISOC.8.37: ou)de

 a)/llo poiou=sin h)\ kaqista=si th

ANDOC.1.150: deu=ro (sc. i)/te?) *)/anute, *ke/fale, e)/ti de\ kai\ oi( fule/tai oi( h(|rhme/noi moi sundikei=n, *qra/sullos kai\ oi( a)/lloi.
XEN. An. 7.7.57: fanero\s h)=n oi)/kade (sc. i)e/nai?) paraskeuazo/menos , Hell. 2.3.20: keleu/santes e)pi\ ta\ o(/pla (sc. i)e/nai?)
