[34], 8: e)n pa/sh| a)pori/a| h)=n. 36.16 (= [58], 22): pa/sas ai)ti/as. 57.27: kai/toi pa=si/n e)stin a)nqrw/pois te/los tou= bi/ou qa/natos. [So pa/ntes (a(/pantes) a)/nqrwpoi and forms occur at least fourscore times, e.g. 1.22. 7.8. 18. 29. 8.5. 35. 42. 9.6. 14. 22. 18.72. 87. 93. 97. 200. 215. 271. 275. 297.] Ep. [4], 3: th\n po/lin th\n u(mete/ran eu)tuxesta/thn pasw=n to/lewn u(polamba/nw.

AESCHIN.1.4: para\ pa=sin a)nqrw/pois (so 2.152. 3.6. 132. 152). 67: o)ligw/rws de\ e)/xontas pro\s a(/pasan ai)sxu/nhn. 76: pa=sa a)na/gkh (sim. 87). 122: katafronou=ntos . . . a(pa/shs blasfhmi/as. 178 (= 3.170): e)pi\ pa=si dikai/ois. 2.181: meta\ pa/shs eu)noi/as. 3.114: kata\ pa/nta tro/pon.

ISOC.2.6: th\n basilei/an . . . panto\s a)ndro\s ei)=nai nomi/zousin. 2.26: pa/ntwn a)nqrw/pwn (and so about 40 exx. of pa/ntes (a(/pantes) a)/nqrwpoi and forms). 3.31: e)k panto\s tro/pou (10 other exx.). 4.151 (= 12.17): pa/nta tro/pon. 8.19: pa/ntas tro/pous. 12.138: pa=sa politei/a. 13.20: eu)qu\s a)\n e)n pa=sin ei)/h kakoi=s. 18.11: pa/ntwn kakw=n. 19.47 (see above).

LYS. 1.2: tau/thn th\n u(/brin a(/pantes a)/nqrwpoi deinota/thn h(gou=ntai . (Similarly pa/ntes (a(/pantes) a)/nqrwpoi and forms occur nearly 30 times.) [6], 3: pa/nta a)/nqrwpon . [9], 19: e)k panto\s tro/pou (= 13.28. [91]. 16.1). 12.57: pa/nta kaka/ (twice). 13.25: panti\ tro/pw| . 14.38: pa/shs po/lews . 15.1: pa=san proqumi/an . 18.17: pa/ntwn kakw=n . 19.11 (= 53): pa/sh| te/xnh| kai\ mhxanh=| . 31.6: pa=sa (every) gh= . 34: pa/shs dhmokrati/as a)llo/tria .
ANDOC.1.1(= 3.16): e)k panto\s tro/pou. 1.116: pa/ntwn a)nqrw/- pwn (sim. 7 other exx.). 2.1: deino/taton a(pa/ntwn xrhma/twn h(gou=mai. 21: a)nti\ pa/ntwn xrhma/twn.

ANTIPHON, 1.23: panti\ tro/pw|. 2, a, 2: pa/shs u(poyi/as fulakh/n. b, 11 (= d, 3. 4, g, 6. d, 10): e)k panto\s tro/pou. 3, g, 5: a(pa/shs me\n gh=s a(marto/nta, pa/ntwn de\ swma/twn. 5.14: ka/llista no/mwn a(pa/ntwn. 17: paranomw/tata a(pa/ntwn a)nqrw/pwn. 6.48: a)nosiwta/tous pa/ntwn a)nqrw/pwn.

PLATO. There are nearly 1000 instances of anarthrous pa=s, etc., and less than one fifth of these follow the substantive. With but very few exceptions the reason for the postposition is evident at first sight, the prominence of the substantive causing pa=s to take second place. Anarthrous participles or adjectives other than a)/llos are rarely used with pa=s, and substantives modified by pa=s do not often have another attribute. pa=sa is frequently used in the sense of all, perfect, complete, with such abstracts as a)kri/beia, a)maqi/a, a)na/gkh, a)pori/a, eu)daimoni/a, eu)/noia, h(donh/, paranomi/a, parrhsi/a, proqumi/a, spoudh/, etc. Especially noteworthy are the expressions pa=s a)nh/r, which occurs 57 times, but never a)nh\r pa=s; pa=s a)/nqrwpos, 14 times, with a)/nqrwpos pa=s, 3 times; panti\ tro/pw|, 32 times; pa/ntes (a(/pantes) a)/nqrwpoi and forms, 52 times (4 exx. of second position). Cf. Walbe, l.c., pp. 19 f., 27.30 f.

Conv. 197 B: e)k tou= e)ra=n tw=n kalw=n pa/nt' a)gaqa\ ge/gone kai\ qeoi=s kai\ a)nqrw/pois. Euthyph. 9 A: ti/ soi tekmh/rio/n e)stin w(s pa/ntes qeoi\ h(gou=ntai e)kei=non a)di/kws teqna/nai . . . panto\s ma=llon pa/ntes qeoi\ h(gou=ntai kte(. but B and C: oi( qeoi\ a(/pantes, D and E: pa/ntes oi( qeoi/ (ter). 13 B: ou)kou=n qerapei/a ge pa=sa (of every kind) tau)to
 diapra/ttetai; Legg. 799 C (see above). 808 D (see above). 856 C (see above). 879 C: e)/oike de\ ne/w| panti\ u(po\ ge/rontos plhge/nti r(a|qu/mws o)rgh
 u(pofe/rein. 961 E: kai\ i)atrikh\ u(phresi/a pa=sa. Phaedo, 94 A: e)k tou/tou a)/ra tou= lo/gou h(mi=n pa=sai yuxai\ pa/ntwn zw/|wn o(moi/ws a)gaqai\ e)/sontai, ei)/per o(moi/ws yuxai\ pefu/kasin au)to\ tou=to yuxai\ ei)=nai. Phaedr. 249 E: pa=sa me
 a)nqrw/pou yuxh/. Rpb. 557 D: pa/nta ge/nh politeiw=n.

XEN. An. 3.1.43 (= 7.7.41): e)k panto\s tro/pou. 2.8: ei) . . . dianoou/meqa . . . to\ loipo\n dia\ panto\s pole/mou au)toi=s i)e/nai. 22: pa/ntes ga\r potamoi\ . . . prosiou=si pro\s ta\s phga\s diabatoi\ gi/gnontai (“pa/ntes ga\r potamoi\ pr, s. v. C, add. me\n et oi(.” — Gemoll). 5.11: pa=s (every) . . . a)sko/s. 4.5.16 (= 7.2.8): pa/sh| te/xnh| kai\ mhxanh=|. 29: e)n pa=sin a)fqo/nois. 6.1.31 (cf. 7.6.18): o)mnu/w u(mi=n qeou\s pa/ntas kai\ pa/sas. 4.6: fe/rei ga\r h( gh= . . . o)/spria pa/nta. 6.30: kata\ pa/nta tro/pon. 7.7.46: pa/ntas a)nqrw/pous.

THUC.1.20.1: panti\ e(ch=s tekmhri/w| pisteu=sai. 34.1: pa=sa a)poiki/a. 118.2 (= 6.88.8): pa/sh| proqumi/a|. 144.4: panti\ tro/pw| (13 exx.). 2.19.1: pa=san i)di/an [similarly 77.2. 3.81.5. 83.1. 98.3. 112.7. 7.29.5 (see below)]. 38.2: e)k pa/shs gh=s. 41.4: pa=san me\n qa/lassan kai\ gh=n. 43.3: pa=sa gh=. 51.3: pa/sh| diai/th|. 64.3: e)n pa=sin a)nqrw/pois. 3.63.1: pa/shs zhmi/as. 4.11.3: proqumi/a| te pa/sh| xrw/menoi kai\ parakaleusmw=|. 6.22: ou) pa/shs e)/stai po/lews. 6.87.4: e)n panti\ . . . xwri/w|. 92.4: e)k panto\s tro/pou. 5: e)s ki/ndunon kai\ e)s talaipwri/an pa=san. 7.29.5: a)/llh te taraxh\ ou)k o)li/gh kai\ i)de/a pa=sa kaqeisth/kei o)le/qrou.

HDT.1.8: e)gw\ de\ pei/qomai e)kei/nhn ei)=nai pase/wn gunaikw=n kalli/sthn (similarly with the genitives nh/swn 1.170; xw|re/wn 193; potamw=n 2.19; proba/twn 41; poli/wn 157; etc.). 1.21 (= 2.113. 115. 9.9): pa/nta lo/gon, every bit of information (but 1.122 elsew.: to
 pa/nta lo/gon, the whole story). 1.25: mou=nos dh\ pa/ntwn a)nqrw/pwn (“always pa/ntes a)/nqrwpoi or a)/nqrwpoi pa/ntes without the article; once (3.38) there is found in Rsv oi( pa/ntes a)/nqrwpoi.” — Kallenberg, l.c., 205 f.). 1.32: skope/ein de\ xrh\ panto\s xrh/matos th
 teleuth/n. 34: a)nqrw/pwn a(pa/ntwn o)lbiw/taton. 86: pa=si tura/nnoisi. 87: pa/nta . . . a)/ndra. 111: e)pi/tec e)ou=sa pa=san h(me/rhn. 126: th
 me
 ga prote/rhn h(me/rhn pa/nta sfi kaka\ e)/xein, th
 de\ to/te pareou=san pa/nta a)gaqa/. 136 (= 2.4. 99): a)na\ pa=n e)/tos. 189: pa/nta tro/pon. 199: pa=san gunai=ka e)pixwri/hn. 2.11 (= 37. 130): a)na\ pa=san h(me/rhn. 22 (= 35. 90): pa=sa a)na/gkh. 124: pa=san eu)nomi/hn . . . e)s pa=san kako/thta. 132 (= 8.65): a)na\ pa/nta e)/tea. 3.89: a)gaqa/ sfi pa/nta e)mhxanh/sato. 152: pa/nta sofi/smata kai\ pa/sas mhxana/s. 4.85 (134). 139: promhqi/hn pa=san. 5.24 (135). 6.37 (134). 139: tra/pezan e)piple/hn a)gaqw=n pa/ntwn (= pantoi/wn).

AR. Ach. 1025-6: w(/per m' e)trefe/thn | e)n pa=si boli/tois. Eq. 522: pa/sas . . . fwna/s. 1006 (= 1010): peri\ a(pa/ntwn pragma/twn. 1112-3: pa/ntes a)/nqrwpoi. Nub. 1132: ma/lista pasw=n h(merw=n . Vesp. 547: pa=san glw=ttan basa/nize. 562: pa/sas fwna/s. 709: e)/zwn e)n pa=si lagw/|ois. 923: kunw=n a(pa/ntwn a)/ndra monofagi/staton. Pax, 373: a(/pas' a)na/gkh. Av. 1059: qnatoi\ pa/ntes . 1281: a(/pantes a)/nqrwpoi . Lys. 484: pro/sfere pa/ntas e)le/gxous . 726: pa/sas te profa/seis . Thesm. 271: pa/sais te/xnais. Ran. 618: pa/nta tro/pon. Eccl. 826 (= 829): pa=s a)nh/r. Pl. 430: e)k pa/shs me xw/ras e)kbalei=n. 493: ei)s a(/pan e)/rgon. 812: o)ci\s de\ pa=sa kai\ lopa/dion kai\ xu/tra .

p.hi: pa=s with substantives whose article is implicit.

div2.p: The use of pa=s with a substantive whose article is implicit is chiefly poetical except in phrases and formulae, in enumerations, and with proper names. Comp. 536.538, and 568.

panti\ sqe/nei, DEM.3.6; With all your might. nh\ to
 *di/a kai\ pa/ntas qeou/s, Ibid. 8.49; By Zeus and all the gods. kai\ xeiri\ kai\ podi\ kai\ fwnh=| kai\ pa/sh| duna/mei, AESCHIN.2.115; With hand, and foot, and voice, and utmost strength. e)yeusme/nos a(pa/ntwn *)aqhnai/wn e)nanti/on, DIN.3.1; Having lied in the presence of all the Athenians. me/lei me
 ou)de
 ei)/ me pa=s' ei)=den po/lis, EUR. H. F. 595; It matters naught if all the city sighted me.

DEM.3.6: ei) ga mh\ bohqh/sete panti\ sqe/nei (see above). 8.49: nh\ to

 pa=s *(arpa/gou klauqmw=| katei/xeto. 164: te/kna kai\ gunai=kas kai\ e)/pipla pa/nta (but 7.119: ta\ e)/pipla pa/nta). 192: gh= pa=sa o(/shs a)/rxei. 2.16: oi(/ fasi tri/a mo/ria ei)=nai gh=n pa=san. 21: to

EUR. H. F. 595: me/lei me\n ou)de\n ei)/ me pa=s' ei)=den po/lis (see above. Sim. 1333. Ion, 1225. Or. 1623. Elsew.). Suppl. 1190: pa/shs u(pe\r gh=s *danai+dw=n o(rkwmotei=n. Elsew.
SOPH. Ai. 1178: ge/nous a(/pantos . El. 713: pa=s e)mestw/qh dro/mos . O. C. 741: pa=s se *kadmei/wn lew\s kalei= dikai/ws . Often.
AESCHYL. P.V. 668: o(\s pa=n e)cai+stw/soi ge/nos. Sept. 254: kai\ se\ kai\ pa=san po/lin. Elsew.
PIND. O. 10.76: a)ei/deto de\ pa=n te/menos terpnai=si qali/ais. P. 9.96: panti\ qumw=|. Elsew.
HOM. Od. 22.94 (= 296): xqo/na d' h)/lase panti\ metw)pw|. Elsew.
Il. 1.592: pa=n d' h)=mar fero/mhn. 20.476: pa=n d' u(peqerma/nqh ci/fos ai(/mati. Elsew.

au)to/s, a)/mfw and a)mfo/teroi, e(/kastos, e(ka/teros, po/teros, o(po/teros, ou)de/teros, and the three great demonstratives o(/de, ou(=tos, and e)kei=nos, assume the predicative position. In all these, the first position is the normal one, the second position is the afterthought position.

au)th\ . . . h( paraskeuh/, THUC.6.68.1; The armament itself, of itself, the very armament, the mere armament. ai(/tios me\n e)/gwge ou)k ei)mi\ tou/tou, oi( de\ stratiw=tai au)toi\ (the soldiers themselves) . . . a)qumou=si pro\s th\n e)/codon, XEN. An. 7.1.9.
LYCURG.117: kai\ au)to\s o( *(/ipparxos e)n tau/th| th=| sth/lh| a)nage/graptai. 121: e)n au)th=| th=| xw/ra|. 123: ti/ u(ma=s prosh/kei to\n au)tou= tou= dh/mou th\n swthri/an prodo/nta poih=sai;
ISAE. 11.11: au)to\s o(no/mos dhlw/sei .

ANTIPHON, 2 a 5: au)to\s o( qa/natos. 2 g 8: peri\ . . . au)th=s th=s eu)daimoni/as. 3 b 1: au)tai\ ai( sumforai\ . . . u(p' au)th=s th=s sumfora=s. 3 g 1: au)th\ h( xrei/a. 4 g 3: au)to\ to\ e)/rgon shmai/nei. 4 d 2: au)th\ . . . h( h(liki/a. 5.28: e)c au)tou= tou= lime/nos . . . au)to\ to\ ploi=on. 6.5: au)th=s . . . th=s e)lpi/dos.

PLATO, Criti. 112B: u(p' au)ta\ ta\ pla/gia au)th=s. Gorg. 519 C: u(p' au)th=s th=s po/lews h(=s prostatei=. Phaedo 103 A: ou)k e)n toi=s pro/sqen h(mi=n lo/gois au)to\ to\ e)nanti/on tw=n nuni\ legome/nwn w(mologei=to; Phaedr. 271 C: au)ta\ me\n ta\ r(h/mata ei)pei=n ou)k eu)pete/s.
XEN. An. 37 times, 30 times in the first predicative position, 7 times in the second. See Joost, Sprachgebrauch, etc., p. 77.
THUC.2.41.2: kai\ w(s ou) . . . ko/mpos ta/de . . ., au)th\ h( du/namis th=s po/lews . . . shmai/nei. 6.68.1: au)th\ . . . h( paraskeuh/.

HDT.2.65: kai\ ta\ me
 (sc. qhri/a) su/ntrofa au)toi=si toi=si a)nqrw/poisi, ta\ de\ ou)/. 7.11: au)toi/ te w(/nqrwpoi kai\ h( gh= au)tw=n. 7.23: au)th
 th
 diw/ruxa.

AR. Ach. 139-40: u(p' au)to
 to
 xro/non | o(/t' e)nqadi\ *qe/ognis h)gwni/zeto. Eq. 1090: h( qeo\s au)th/. Nub. 886: au)to\s maqh/setai par' au)toi=n toi=n lo/goin . Vesp. 681: a)ll' au)th/n moi th
 doulei/an ou)k a)pofai/nwn a)poknai/eis.
SOPH. O. C. 1285: au)to\n to\n qeo/n . O. R. 805: au)to/s q' o( pre/sbus. 1169: pro\s au)tw=| . . . tw=| deinw=|. Ph. 572: au)to\s ou(dusseu/s.
AESCHYL. Pers. 792: au)th\ ga\r h( gh= cu/mmaxos kei/nois pe/lei.

HES. O. et D. 349-50: eu)= me\n metrei=sqai para\ gei/tonos, eu)= d' a)podou=nai, | au)tw=| tw=| me/trw|, kai\ lw/ion, ai)/ ke du/nhai. (Usually, but not necessarily, translated by “with the same measure.”)
a)ll' au)to\ dikaiosu/nhn au)th=| yuxh=| a)/riston hu(/romen, PLATO, Rpb. 612B; But we have found that justice “in her own nature” is best for the soul “in her nature.”

PLATO, Parm. 133D-E: ei)/ tis h(mw=n tou despo/ths h)\ dou=lo/s e)stin, ou)k au)tou= despo/tou dh/ pou, o(\ e)/sti despo/ths, e)kei/nou dou=lo/s e)stin, ou)de\ au)tou= dou/lou, o(\ e)/sti dou=los, despo/ths o( despo/ths, a)ll' a)/nqrwpos w)
 a)nqrw/pou a)mfo/tera tau=ta/ e)stin: au)th\ de\ despotei/a au)th=s doulei/as e)sti
 o(/ e)sti, kai\ doulei/a w(sau/tws au)th\ doulei/a au)th=s despotei/as. sim. saepe. (But Waddell puts a comma after w(sau/tws thus joining au)th\ with the following doulei/a.) Rpb. 438 C: e)pisth/mh me
 au)th\ maqh/matos au)tou= e)pisth/mh e)sti/n. 612 B (see above). C: i(/na au)th\ dikaiosu/nh pro\s a)diki/an au)th
 kriqei/h.

SOPH. Ai. 1168: e)s au)to\n kairo/n . Ant. 1217: pro\s au)to\ sto/mion. El. 720: u(p' au)th\n e)sxa/thn sth/lhn. 1396: pro\s au)to\ te/rma. O. C. 1511: au)toi\ qeoi/.
1650: a)/nakta d' au)to/n

AESCHYL. Ag. 37: oi)=kos d' au)to/s. 599: a)/naktos au)tou= pa/nta peu/somai lo/gon. Ch. 127: kai\ gai=an au)th/n. Pers.443: au)tw=| t' a)/nakti. P. V. 721: krota/fwn a)p' au)tw=n . 828: pro\s au)to\ d' ei)=mi te/rma . 847: *nei/lou pro\s au)tw=| sto/mati . Sept. 528: tu/mbon kat' au)to/n.
PIND. O. 13.76-8: au)ta\ | *zhno\s . . . pai=s e)/poren | . . . xruso/n. P. 11.31: qa/nen me\n au)to\s h(/rws *)atrei+/das. N. 5.1: e)p' au)ta=s baqmi/dos. 9.8-9: e)p' au)ta\n . . . | . . . korufa/n.
HES. Theog 640: ne/ktar t' a)mbrosi/hn te, ta/ per qeoi\ au)toi\ e)/dousi.
HOM. Od. 10.158-9: e)/lafon me/gan ei)s o(do\n au)th\n | h(=ken. 416: po/lin au)th/n.

Il. 2.309: au)to\s *)olu/mpios. 8.442: au)to\s . . . *zeu/s. sim. saepe. 12.429: diampere\s a)spi/dos au)th=s. 469-70: oi(\ de\ kat' au)ta\s | poihta\s e)se/xunto pu/las. 13.615: a)/kron u(po\ lo/fon au)to/n. 18.481: au)tou= . . . sa/keos.
For exx. like HOM. Il. 23.8: au)toi=s i(/ppoisi kai\ a(/rmasin a)=sson i)o/ntes, see under au)to/s.
For au)to/s in attributive position, see under au)to/s.
a)/mfw does not occur in Attic ISS (Meisterhans3, p. 233.40) and in prose literature it recedes before a)mfo/teroi.
a)mfoi=n a)polu/etai toi=n e)gklhma/toin, ANTIPHON, 3 b 9; He is acquitted on both charges.
ISAE. 5.16: a)mfoi=n de\ tai=n diaqh/kain a)ku/roin gignome/nain. Cf. 6.6: tw\ me\n ou)=n a)delfw\ au)tw=| . . . a)/mfw a)/paide e)teleuthsa/thn.
ISOC.12.97: plei=stoi me\n ou)=n kathgorou=sin a)mfoi=n toi=n pole/oin.
ANTIPHON, 3 b 9 (see above). 5.51: e)/k te a)mfoi=n toi=n a)ndroi=n.

A substantive qualified by e(/kastos regularly takes the article in prose, but in prepositional and genitive expressions of time it is freely omitted. Isocrates seems never to have omitted the article.

e)pei\ de\ fw=s e)ge/neto, h)=gen e(/kastos o( strathgo\s to
 au(tou= lo/xon e)pi\ kw/mhn, XEN. An. 6.3.2; When it got light, each of the generals led his own company to attack one of the villages. e)ge/nonto me
 lo/xoi . . . a)mfi\ tou\s o)gdoh/konta, o( de\ lo/xos e(/kastos sxedo
 ei)s tou\s e(kato/n, Ibid. 4.8.15; There were about eighty companies, each company averaging about a hundred men. kaq' e(ka/sthn th

AESCHIN.3.114: diwmologh/qh d' au)tw=| . . . a)poste/llesqai *)aqh/naze tou= e)niautou= e(ka/stou mna=s ei)/kosi. This is the only Ms. example, but in seven other instances Blass adds the article. Compare 662.

 au)th=s; 144 C: e(ka/stw| tw=| th=s ou)si/as me/rei. Phaedr. 248 E: h( yuxh\ e(ka/sth. 274 E: peri\ e(ka/sths th=s te/xnhs. Phileb. 32 E: e)n e(ka/stois . . . toi=s zw/|ois. Protag. 315 A: e)c e(ka/stwn tw=n po/lewn. Theaet. 157 C: e(ka/stwn tw=n sofw=n.

PLATO, Crat. 424E: e(ka/stou farma/kou (see 661). Meno 72 A: kaq' e(ka/sthn ga\r tw=n pra/cewn . . . pro\s e(/kaston e)/rgon e(ka/stw| h(mw=n h( a)reth/ e)stin. Rpb. 338 D: ou)kou=n tou=to kratei= e)n e(ka/sth| po/lei, to\ a)/rxon; 342 A: kai\ dei= e(ka/sth| te/xnh| a)/llhs te/xnhs. 344 B: w(=n e)f' e(ka/stw| me/rei. 353 A: kai/ moi dokei= tou=to e(ka/stou pra/gmatos e)/rgon ei)=nai. Theaet. 157 B-C: w(=| dh\ a)qroi/smati a)/nqrwpo/n te ti/qentai kai\ li/qon kai\ e(/kaston zw=|o/n te kai\ ei)=dos.

XEN. An. 1.4.13: u(pe/sxeto a)ndri\ e(ka/stw| dw/sein pe/nte a)rguri/ou mna=s. 4.7.10: e)f' e(ka/sths de\ prodromh=s (v. 1. th=s prodromh=s) ple/on h)\ de/ka a(/macai petrw=n a)nhli/skonto. 5.3.13: e(ka/stou e)/tous (inscription on a stele). The substantive modified by e(ka/teros requiresIn Attic inscriptions there is one instance of an anarthrous substantive with e(ka/teros according to Meisterh.3 p. 233.39. the article.In some authors e(ka/teros is used only substantively; in others it is entirely wanting, as in tragedy and in epic poetry.
e(kate/ra| th=| xeiri/, PLATO, Rpb. 617C; With either hand. tw=| w)ti\ e(kate/rw|, XEN. Cyn. 5.32; With either ear.
ISOC.4.35(= 5.112. 12.44. 166): e)f' e(kate/ras th=s h)pei/rou. 11.19: to\ dia/foron e(kate/ras th=s politei/as.
LYS.26.17: para\ de\ tou/twn e(kate/ras th=s politei/as i(kanh\n ba/sanon e)/xousin.
ANTIPHON, 5.49: e)k toi=n lo/goin toi=n a)ndroi=n e(kate/roin toi=n basanisqe/ntoin.

PLATO, Conv. 187E: e(ka/teron to\n e)/rwta. Euthyd. 299 E: e)n e(kate/rw| tw)fqalmw=|. Phaedr. 263 B: ei)lhfe/nai tina\ xarakth=ra e(kate/rou tou= ei)/dous. Phileb. 32 B: e)n tou/tois toi=s pa/qesin e(kate/rois. Politic. 264 D: e)f' e(kate/rw| tou/twn to\ me/ros au)th=s e)pine/montas e(ka/teron. Rpb. 547 B: e(kate/rw tw\ ge/nei. 617 C (see above). p.hi: o(/de, ou(=tos, e)kei=nos in Predicative Position:

div2.p: For further examples of the predicative position and for the use of demonstratives with anarthrous substantives, see Demonstratives. Compare also A. J. P. xxiii, 8.

p.hi: Use and omission of the article with the predicate.

div2.p: As the article serves to point out that which is supposed to be already present to the mind and the predicate generally introduces something new, the article is not much used with the predicate except in convertible propositions, that is, those statements in which predicate may be subject or subject predicate. Otherwise the article serves to quote or to refer.

div2.head: Article with several attributes.
div2.p: When there are several attributes, the article may or may not be repeated. If the article is not repeated, the second modifier may follow the substantive, chiefly in poetry, and thus suggests a predicative translation.

p.hi: Repetition of Article, One of the Modifiers Following its Substantive:

div2.p: These examples present no peculiarity from the point of view of the article. They show only the ordinary complex of the second attributive position with an added modifier in the first half.

DEM.18.255: th
 . . . i)di/an tu/xhn th
 e)mh
 . . . th
 i)di/an tu/xhn th
 e)mh/n (669).
ISOC.6.64: to\n a)/llon o)/xlon to\n e)n *heloponnh/sw| .

PLATO, Conv. 209D: tou\s a)/llous poihta\s tou\s a)gaqou/s . Euthyd. 272 E: a)nistame/nou de/ mou e)ge/neto to\ ei)wqo\s shmei=on to\ daimo/nion . Legg. 664 C: o( mousw=n xoro\s o( paidiko\s o)rqo/tat' a)\n ei)si/oi prw=tos . Meno, 80 A: dokei=s moi . . . o(moio/tatos ei)=nai tau/th| th=| plat ei/a| na/rkh| th=| qalatti/a| . Phaedo, 64 D: tou\s a)/llous kallwpismou\s tou\s peri\ to\ sw=ma (cf. ibid. ta\s a)/llas ta\s peri\ to\ sw=ma qerapei/as ). Rpb. 415 D: oi( . . . a)/lloi a)/nqrwpoi oi( u(/steron .

XEN. Cyr. 4.6.5: e)/qaya . . . to\n a)/riston pai=da to\n a)gaphto/n . Hell. 3.4.13: oi( tou= *farnaba/zou i(ppei=s oi( peri\ *(raqi/nhn kai\ *bagai=on . Oec. 8.11: ei)s to\ me/ga ploi=on to\ *foinikiko/n .
THUC. 8.13: ai( a)po\ th=s *sikeli/as *heloponnhsi/wn e(kkai/deka nh=es ai( meta\ *guli/ppou cundiapolemh/sasai .

PINDAR. The examples commonly cited are not cogent.

HOM. Od. 3.299-300:
a)ta\r ta\s pe/nte ne/as kuanoprw|rei/ous
*ai)gu/ptw| e)pe/lasse fe/rwn a)/nemo/s te kai\ u(/dwr
.
Predicative adjectives limiting substantives that have one or more attributive modifiers, often assume a seemingly attributive position.

to\n a)/llon a(/panta xro/non, DEM. 9.22 ; In all the past.
th=s au)th=s tau/ths nukto/s, THUC. 8.102.1 ; That very night.
